member.name: T:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Collision.Broadphase.DynamicTree`1
member.summary: A dynamic tree arranges data in a binary tree to accelerate queries such as volume queries and ray casts. Leafs are proxies with an AABB. In the tree we expand the proxy AABB by Settings.b2_fatAABBFactor so that the proxy AABB is bigger than the client object. This allows the client object to move by small amounts without triggering a tree update. Nodes are pooled and relocatable, so we use node indices rather than pointers.

member.summary: Create a proxy in the tree as a leaf node. We return the index of the node instead of a pointer so that we can grow the node pool.

member.summary: Destroy a proxy. This asserts if the id is invalid.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Collision.Broadphase.DynamicTree`1.MoveProxy(System.Int32,Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Shared.Aabb@,System.Numerics.Vector2)
member.summary: Move a proxy with a swepted AABB. If the proxy has moved outside of its fattened AABB, then the proxy is removed from the tree and re-inserted. Otherwise the function returns immediately.
member.returns: true if the proxy was re-inserted.

member.summary: Describes whether this instance was moved

member.summary: Clears the moved using the specified proxy id

member.summary: Get proxy user data.

member.summary: Get the fat AABB for a proxy.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Collision.Broadphase.DynamicTree`1.Query(System.Func{System.Int32,System.Boolean},Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Shared.Aabb@)
member.summary: Query an AABB for overlapping proxies. The callback class is called for each proxy that overlaps the supplied AABB.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Collision.Broadphase.DynamicTree`1.RayCast(System.Func{Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Collision.RayCast.RayCastInput,System.Int32,System.Single},Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Collision.RayCast.RayCastInput@)
member.summary: Ray-cast against the proxies in the tree. This relies on the callback to perform a exact ray-cast in the case were the proxy contains a Shape. The callback also performs the any collision filtering. This has performance roughly equal to k * log(n), where k is the number of collisions and n is the number of proxies in the tree.
member.param: A callback class that is called for each proxy that is hit by the ray.
The ray-cast input data. The ray extends from p1 to p1 + maxFraction * (p2 - p1).

member.name: T:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Collision.Broadphase.DynamicTreeBroadPhase
member.summary: The broad-phase is used for computing pairs and performing volume queries and ray casts. This broad-phase does not persist pairs. Instead, this reports potentially new pairs. It is up to the client to consume the new pairs and to track subsequent overlap.

member.summary: Query an AABB for overlapping proxies. The callback class is called for each proxy that overlaps the supplied AABB.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Collision.Broadphase.DynamicTreeBroadPhase.RayCast(System.Func{Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Collision.RayCast.RayCastInput,System.Int32,System.Single},Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Collision.RayCast.RayCastInput@)
member.summary: Ray-cast against the proxies in the tree. This relies on the callback to perform a exact ray-cast in the case were the proxy contains a shape. The callback also performs the any collision filtering. This has performance roughly equal to k * log(n), where k is the number of collisions and n is the number of proxies in the tree.
member.param: A callback class that is called for each proxy that is hit by the ray.
The ray-cast input data. The ray extends from p1 to p1 + maxFraction * (p2 - p1).

member.name: T:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Collision.Narrowphase.Manifold
member.summary: A manifold for two touching convex Shapes. Box2D supports multiple types of contact: - Clip point versus plane with radius - Point versus point with radius (circles) The local point usage depends on the manifold type: - ShapeType.Circles: the local center of circleA - SeparationFunction.FaceA: the center of faceA - SeparationFunction.FaceB: the center of faceB Similarly the local normal usage: - ShapeType.Circles: not used - SeparationFunction.FaceA: the normal on polygonA - SeparationFunction.FaceB: the normal on polygonB We store contacts in this way so that position correction can account for movement, which is critical for continuous physics. All contact scenarios must be expressed in one of these types. This structure is stored across time steps, so we keep it small.

member.summary: The type

member.name: T:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Collision.Narrowphase.ManifoldPoint
member.summary: A manifold point is a contact point belonging to a contact manifold. It holds details related to the geometry and dynamics of the contact points. The local point usage depends on the manifold type: -ShapeType.Circles: the local center of circleB -SeparationFunction.FaceA: the local center of cirlceB or the clip point of polygonB -SeparationFunction.FaceB: the clip point of polygonA This structure is stored across time steps, so we keep it small. Note: the impulses are used for internal caching and may not provide reliable contact forces, especially for high speed collisions.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Collision.RayCast.RayCastInput.MaxFraction
member.summary: The ray extends from p1 to p1 + maxFraction * (p2 - p1). If you supply a max fraction of 1, the ray extends from p1 to p2. A max fraction of 0.5 makes the ray go from p1 and half way to p2.

member.name: T:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Collision.Shapes.ChainShape
member.summary: A chain shape is a free form sequence of line segments. The chain has one-sided collision, with the surface normal pointing to the right of the edge. This provides a counter-clockwise winding like the polygon shape. Connectivity information is used to create smooth collisions. Warning: the chain will not collide properly if there are self-intersections.

member.param: The vertices to use. Must contain 2 or more vertices.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Collision.TOI.TimeOfImpact.CalculateTimeOfImpact(Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Collision.TOI.ToiInput@,Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Collision.TOI.ToiOutput@)
member.summary: Compute the upper bound on time before two shapes penetrate. Time is represented as a fraction between [0,tMax]. This uses a swept separating axis and may miss some intermediate, non-tunneling collision. If you change the time interval, you should call this function again. Note: use Distance() to compute the contact point and normal at the time of impact.

member.name: T:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Config.Settings
member.summary: The settings class

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Config.Settings.MaxManifoldPoints
member.summary: The maximum number of contact points between two convex shapes. DO NOT CHANGE THIS VALUE!

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Config.Settings.EnableSubStepping
member.summary: Enable or disable sub stepping. Used for debugging.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Config.Settings.BlockSolve
member.summary: Enable or disable the block contact solver. Used for debugging.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Config.Settings.SkipSanityChecks
member.summary: Set this to true to skip sanity checks in the engine. This will speed up the tools by removing the overhead of the checks, but you will need to handle checks yourself where it is needed.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Config.Settings.UseConvexHullPolygons
member.summary: If true, it will run a GiftWrap convex hull on all polygon inputs. This makes for a more stable engine when given random input, but if speed of the creation of polygons are more important, you might want to set this to false.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Config.Settings.UseFpeCollisionCategories
member.summary: Velcro Physics has a different way of filtering fixtures than Box2d. We have both FPE and Box2D filtering in the engine. If you are upgrading from earlier versions of FPE, set this to true and DefaultFixtureCollisionCategories to Category.All.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Config.Settings.DefaultFixtureCollisionCategories
member.summary: This is used by the Fixture constructor as the default value for Fixture.CollisionCategories member. Note that you may need to change this depending on the setting of UseFPECollisionCategories, above.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Config.Settings.DefaultFixtureCollidesWith
member.summary: This is used by the Fixture constructor as the default value for Fixture.CollidesWith member.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Config.Settings.DefaultFixtureIgnoreCcdWith
member.summary: This is used by the Fixture constructor as the default value for Fixture.IgnoreCCDWith member.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Config.Settings.DefaultCollisionGroup
member.summary: Set the default collision group

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Config.Settings.MaxGjkIterations
member.summary: Defines the maximum number of iterations made by the GJK algorithm.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Config.Settings.AabbExtension
member.summary: This is used to fatten AABBs in the dynamic tree. This allows proxies to move by a small amount without triggering a tree adjustment. This is in meters.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Config.Settings.AabbMultiplier
member.summary: This is used to fatten AABBs in the dynamic tree. This is used to predict the future position based on the current displacement. This is a dimensionless multiplier.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Config.Settings.LinearSlop
member.summary: A small length used as a collision and constraint tolerance. Usually it is chosen to be numerically significant, but visually insignificant.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Config.Settings.AngularSlop
member.summary: A small angle used as a collision and constraint tolerance. Usually it is chosen to be numerically significant, but visually insignificant.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Config.Settings.MaxSubSteps
member.summary: Maximum number of sub-steps per contact in continuous physics simulation.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Config.Settings.MaxToiContacts
member.summary: Maximum number of contacts to be handled to solve a TOI impact.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Config.Settings.MaxLinearCorrection
member.summary: The maximum linear position correction used when solving constraints. This helps to prevent overshoot.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Config.Settings.MaxAngularCorrection
member.summary: The maximum angular position correction used when solving constraints. This helps to prevent overshoot.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Config.Settings.MaxTranslation
member.summary: The maximum linear velocity of a body. This limit is very large and is used to prevent numerical problems. You shouldn't need to adjust this.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Config.Settings.MaxRotation
member.summary: The maximum angular velocity of a body. This limit is very large and is used to prevent numerical problems. You shouldn't need to adjust this.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Config.Settings.Baumgarte
member.summary: This scale factor controls how fast overlap is resolved. Ideally this would be 1 so that overlap is removed in one time step. However using values close to 1 often lead to overshoot.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Config.Settings.ToiBaumgarte
member.summary: The toi baumgarte

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Config.Settings.TimeToSleep
member.summary: The time that a body must be still before it will go to sleep.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Config.Settings.LinearSleepTolerance
member.summary: A body cannot sleep if its linear velocity is above this tolerance.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Config.Settings.AngularSleepTolerance
member.summary: A body cannot sleep if its angular velocity is above this tolerance.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Config.Settings.AutoClearForces
member.summary: By default, forces are cleared automatically after each call to Step. The default behavior is modified with this setting. The purpose of this setting is to support sub-stepping. Sub-stepping is often used to maintain a fixed sized time step under a variable frame-rate. When you perform sub-stepping you should disable auto clearing of forces and instead call ClearForces after all sub-steps are complete in one pass of your game loop.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Config.Settings.MaxPolygonVertices
member.summary: The maximum number of vertices on a convex polygon.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Config.Settings.PolygonRadius
member.summary: The radius of the polygon/edge shape skin. This should not be modified. Making this smaller means polygons will have an insufficient buffer for continuous collision. Making it larger may create artifacts for vertex collision.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Config.Settings.MixFriction
member.summary: Gets called when there is a collision between 2 fixtures. The first two parameters are the friction values of either fixture. The return value should be the desired friction value of the collection.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Config.Settings.MixRestitution
member.summary: Gets called when there is a collision between 2 fixtures. The first two parameters are the restitution values of either fixture. The return value should be the desired restitution value of the collection.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Config.Settings.MixRestitutionThreshold
member.summary: The default mix restitution threshold

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Config.Settings.DefaultMixFriction(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Friction mixing law. The idea is to allow either fixture to drive the friction to zero. For example, anything slides on ice.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Config.Settings.DefaultMixRestitution(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Restitution mixing law. The idea is allow for anything to bounce off an inelastic surface. For example, a superball bounces on anything.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Config.Settings.DefaultMixRestitutionThreshold(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Restitution mixing law. This picks the lowest value.

member.summary: Is this a fast moving body that should be prevented from tunneling through other moving bodies? Note that all bodies are prevented from tunneling through kinematic and static bodies. This setting is only considered on dynamic bodies. Warning: You should use this flag sparingly since it increases processing time.

member.summary: Set this flag to false if this body should never fall asleep. Note: Setting this to false increases CPU usage.

member.name: T:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Definitions.Joints.PrismaticJointDef
member.summary: Prismatic joint definition. This requires defining a line of motion using an axis and an anchor point. The definition uses local anchor points and a local axis so that the initial configuration can violate the constraint slightly. The joint translation is zero when the local anchor points coincide in world space. Using local anchors and a local axis helps when saving and loading a game.

member.name: T:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Definitions.Joints.RevoluteJointDef
member.summary: Revolute joint definition. This requires defining an anchor point where the bodies are joined. The definition uses local anchor points so that the initial configuration can violate the constraint slightly. You also need to specify the initial relative angle for joint limits. This helps when saving and loading a game. The local anchor points are measured from the body's origin rather than the center of mass because: 1. you might not know where the center of mass will be. 2. if you add/remove shapes from a body and recompute the mass, the joints will be broken.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this body should be included in the CCD solver.
member.value: true if this instance is included in CCD; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Dynamics.Body.SleepingAllowed
member.summary: You can disable sleeping on this body. If you disable sleeping, the body will be woken.
member.value: true if sleeping is allowed; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Dynamics.Body.Awake
member.summary: Set the sleep state of the body. A sleeping body has very low CPU cost.

member.name: P:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Dynamics.Body.Enabled
member.summary: Set the active state of the body. An inactive body is not simulated and cannot be collided with or woken up. If you pass a flag of true, all fixtures will be added to the broad-phase. If you pass a flag of false, all fixtures will be removed from the broad-phase and all contacts will be destroyed. Fixtures and joints are otherwise unaffected. You may continue to create/destroy fixtures and joints on inactive bodies. Fixtures on an inactive body are implicitly inactive and will not participate in collisions, ray-casts, or queries. Joints connected to an inactive body are implicitly inactive. An inactive body is still owned by a b2World object and remains in the body list.

member.name: P:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Dynamics.Body.FixedRotation
member.summary: Set this body to have fixed rotation. This causes the mass to be reset.
member.value: true if it has fixed rotation; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Gets all the fixtures attached to this body.

member.summary: Get the list of all joints attached to this body.

member.name: P:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Dynamics.Body.ContactList
member.summary: Get the list of all contacts attached to this body. Warning: this list changes during the time step and you may miss some collisions if you don't use ContactListener.

member.returns: Return the world position of the body's origin.

member.name: P:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Dynamics.Body.IgnoreCcdWith
member.summary: Body objects can define which categories of bodies they wish to ignore CCD with. This allows certain bodies to be configured to ignore CCD with objects that aren't a penetration problem due to the way content has been prepared. This is compared against the other Body's fixture CollisionCategories within World.SolveTOI().

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Dynamics.Body.ResetDynamics
member.summary: Resets the dynamics of this body. Sets torque, force and linear/angular velocity to 0

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Dynamics.Body.AddFixture(Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Definitions.FixtureDef)
member.summary: Creates a fixture and attach it to this body. If the density is non-zero, this function automatically updates the mass of the body. Contacts are not created until the next time step. Warning: This function is locked during callbacks.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Dynamics.Body.AddFixture(Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Collision.Shapes.Shape)
member.summary: Creates a fixture and attach it to this body. If the density is non-zero, this function automatically updates the mass of the body. Contacts are not created until the next time step. Warning: This function is locked during callbacks.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Dynamics.Body.RemoveFixture(Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Dynamics.Fixture)
member.summary: Destroy a fixture. This removes the fixture from the broad-phase and destroys all contacts associated with this fixture. This will automatically adjust the mass of the body if the body is dynamic and the fixture has positive density. All fixtures attached to a body are implicitly destroyed when the body is destroyed. Warning: This function is locked during callbacks.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Dynamics.Body.SetTransform(System.Numerics.Vector2,System.Single)
member.summary: Set the position of the body's origin and rotation. This breaks any contacts and wakes the other bodies. Manipulating a body's transform may cause non-physical behavior.
member.param: The world position of the body's local origin.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Dynamics.Body.SetTransform(System.Numerics.Vector2@,System.Single)
member.summary: Set the position of the body's origin and rotation. This breaks any contacts and wakes the other bodies. Manipulating a body's transform may cause non-physical behavior.
member.param: The world position of the body's local origin.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Dynamics.Body.GetTransform(Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Shared.Transform@)
member.summary: Get the body transform for the body's origin.
member.param: The transform of the body's origin.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Dynamics.Body.ApplyForce(System.Numerics.Vector2,System.Numerics.Vector2)
member.summary: Apply a force at a world point. If the force is not applied at the center of mass, it will generate a torque and affect the angular velocity. This wakes up the body.
member.param: The world force vector, usually in Newtons (N).
The world position of the point of application.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Dynamics.Body.ApplyForce(System.Numerics.Vector2@)
member.summary: Applies a force at the center of mass.

member.summary: Applies a force at the center of mass.

member.summary: Apply a force at a world point. If the force is not applied at the center of mass, it will generate a torque and affect the angular velocity. This wakes up the body.
member.param: The world force vector, usually in Newtons (N).
The world position of the point of application.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Dynamics.Body.ApplyTorque(System.Single)
member.summary: Apply a torque. This affects the angular velocity without affecting the linear velocity of the center of mass.
member.param: The torque about the z-axis (out of the screen), usually in N-m.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Dynamics.Body.ApplyLinearImpulse(System.Numerics.Vector2)
member.summary: Apply an impulse at a point. This immediately modifies the velocity. This wakes up the body.
member.param: The world impulse vector, usually in N-seconds or kg-m/s.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Dynamics.Body.ApplyLinearImpulse(System.Numerics.Vector2,System.Numerics.Vector2)
member.summary: Apply an impulse at a point. This immediately modifies the velocity. It also modifies the angular velocity if the point of application is not at the center of mass. This wakes up the body.
member.param: The world impulse vector, usually in N-seconds or kg-m/s.
The world position of the point of application.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Dynamics.Body.ApplyLinearImpulse(System.Numerics.Vector2@)
member.summary: Apply an impulse at a point. This immediately modifies the velocity. This wakes up the body.
member.param: The world impulse vector, usually in N-seconds or kg-m/s.

member.summary: Apply an impulse at a point. This immediately modifies the velocity. It also modifies the angular velocity if the point of application is not at the center of mass. This wakes up the body.
member.param: The world impulse vector, usually in N-seconds or kg-m/s.
The world position of the point of application.

member.summary: This resets the mass properties to the sum of the mass properties of the fixtures. This normally does not need to be called unless you called SetMassData to override the mass and you later want to reset the mass.

member.name: T:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Dynamics.Fixture
member.summary: A fixture is used to attach a Shape to a body for collision detection. A fixture inherits its transform from its parent. Fixtures hold additional non-geometric data such as friction, collision filters, etc. Fixtures are created via Body.CreateFixture. Warning: You cannot reuse fixtures.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Dynamics.Fixture.AfterCollision
member.summary: Fires after two shapes has collided and are solved. This gives you a chance to get the impact force.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Dynamics.Fixture.BeforeCollision
member.summary: Fires when two fixtures are close to each other. Due to how the broadphase works, this can be quite inaccurate as shapes are approximated using AABBs.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Dynamics.Fixture.OnSeparation
member.summary: Fires when two shapes separate and a contact is removed between them. Note: This can in some cases be called multiple times, as a fixture can have multiple contacts. Note The first fixture argument is always the fixture that the delegate is subscribed to.

member.summary: Get or set the restitution threshold. This will _not_ change the restitution threshold of existing contacts.

member.name: P:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Dynamics.Fixture.CollisionGroup
member.summary: Defaults to 0 If Settings.UseFPECollisionCategories is set to false: Collision groups allow a certain group of objects to never collide (negative) or always collide (positive). Zero means no collision group. Non-zero group filtering always wins against the mask bits. If Settings.UseFPECollisionCategories is set to true: If 2 fixtures are in the same collision group, they will not collide.

member.name: P:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Dynamics.Fixture.CollidesWith
member.summary: Defaults to Category.All The collision mask bits. This states the categories that this fixture would accept for collision. Use Settings.UseFPECollisionCategories to change the behavior.

member.name: P:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Dynamics.Fixture.CollisionCategories
member.summary: The collision categories this fixture is a part of. If Settings.UseFPECollisionCategories is set to false: Defaults to Category.Cat1 If Settings.UseFPECollisionCategories is set to true: Defaults to Category.All

member.name: P:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Dynamics.Fixture.Shape
member.summary: Get the child Shape. You can modify the child Shape, however you should not change the number of vertices because this will crash some collision caching mechanisms.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this fixture is a sensor.
member.value: true if this instance is a sensor; otherwise, false.

member.summary: This requires defining an anchor point on both bodies and the non-zero length of the distance joint. If you don't supply a length, the local anchor points is used so that the initial configuration can violate the constraint slightly. This helps when saving and loading a game. Warning Do not use a zero or short length.
member.param: Set to true if you are using world coordinates as anchors.

member.name: T:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Dynamics.Joints.FixedMouseJoint
member.summary: A mouse joint is used to make a point on a body track a specified world point. This a soft constraint with a maximum force. This allows the constraint to stretch and without applying huge forces. NOTE: this joint is not documented in the manual because it was developed to be used in the testbed. If you want to learn how to use the mouse joint, look at the testbed.

member.name: T:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Dynamics.Joints.GearJoint
member.summary: A gear joint is used to connect two joints together. Either joint can be a revolute or prismatic joint. You specify a gear ratio to bind the motions together: coordinate1 + ratio * coordinate2 = ant The ratio can be negative or positive. If one joint is a revolute joint and the other joint is a prismatic joint, then the ratio will have units of length or units of 1/length. Warning: You have to manually destroy the gear joint if jointA or jointB is destroyed.

member.summary: This requires defining a line of motion using an axis and an anchor point. The definition uses local anchor points and a local axis so that the initial configuration can violate the constraint slightly. The joint translation is zero when the local anchor points coincide in world space. Using local anchors and a local axis helps when saving and loading a game.
member.param: Set to true if you are using world coordinates as anchors.

member.name: T:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Dynamics.Joints.PulleyJoint
member.summary: The pulley joint is connected to two bodies and two fixed world points. The pulley supports a ratio such that: length1 + ratio * length2 <= constant Yes, the force transmitted is scaled by the ratio. Warning: the pulley joint can get a bit squirrelly by itself. They often work better when combined with prismatic joints. You should also cover the the anchor points with static shapes to prevent one side from going to zero length.

member.name: T:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Dynamics.Joints.RevoluteJoint
member.summary: A revolute joint constrains to bodies to share a common point while they are free to rotate about the point. The relative rotation about the shared point is the joint angle. You can limit the relative rotation with a joint limit that specifies a lower and upper angle. You can use a motor to drive the relative rotation about the shared point. A maximum motor torque is provided so that infinite forces are not generated.

member.name: T:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Dynamics.Joints.WeldJoint
member.summary: A weld joint essentially glues two bodies together. A weld joint may distort somewhat because the island constraint solver is approximate. The joint is soft constraint based, which means the two bodies will move relative to each other, when a force is applied. To combine two bodies in a rigid fashion, combine the fixtures to a single body instead.

member.summary: The frequency of the joint. A higher frequency means a stiffer joint, but a too high value can cause the joint to oscillate. Default is 0, which means the joint does no spring calculations.

member.summary: The damping on the joint. The damping is only used when the joint has a frequency (> 0). A higher value means more damping.

member.name: T:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Dynamics.Joints.WheelJoint
member.summary: A wheel joint. This joint provides two degrees of freedom: translation along an axis fixed in bodyA and rotation in the plane. In other words, it is a point to line constraint with a rotational motor and a linear spring/damper. The spring/damper is initialized upon creation. This joint is designed for vehicle suspensions.

If the position is before the beginning of the the difference will be subtracted from its value; otherwise the difference will be added.

members.member:
Winding number test for a point in a polygon. See more info about the algorithm here: http://softsurfer.com/Archive/algorithm_0103/algorithm_0103.htm The point to be tested.
-1 if the winding number is zero and the point is outside the polygon, 1 if the point is inside the polygon, and 0 if the point is on the polygons edge.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Shared.Vertices.PointInPolygonAngle(System.Numerics.Vector2@)
member.summary: Compute the sum of the angles made between the test point and each pair of points making up the polygon. If this sum is 2pi then the point is an interior point, if 0 then the point is an exterior point. ref: http://ozviz.wasp.uwa.edu.au/~pbourke/geometry/insidepoly/ - Solution 2

member.summary: Implements "A new algorithm for Boolean operations on general polygons" available here: http://liama.ia.ac.cn/wiki/_media/user:dong:dong_cg_05.pdf Merges two polygons, a subject and a clip with the specified operation. Polygons may not be self-intersecting. Warning: May yield incorrect results or even crash if polygons contain collinear points.
member.param: The clip polygon, which is added, substracted or intersected with the subject
The operation to be performed. Either Union, Difference or Intersection.
member.returns: A list of closed polygons, which make up the result of the clipping operation. Outer contours are ordered counter clockwise, holes are ordered clockwise.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Tools.TextureTools.MarchingSquares.CxFastList`1.Pop
member.summary: pop element from head of list (O(1)) Note: this does not return the object popped! There is good reason to this, and it regards the Alloc list variants which guarantee objects are released to the object pool. You do not want to retrieve an element through pop or else that object may suddenly be used by another piece of code which retrieves it from the object pool.

member.name: T:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Tools.Triangulation.Bayazit.BayazitDecomposer
member.summary: Convex decomposition algorithm created by Mark Bayazit (http://mnbayazit.com/) Properties: - Tries to decompose using polygons instead of triangles. - Tends to produce optimal results with low processing time. - Running time is O(nr), n = number of vertices, r = reflex vertices. - Does not support holes. For more information about this algorithm, see http://mnbayazit.com/406/bayazit

member.name: T:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Tools.Triangulation.Delaunay.CdtDecomposer
member.summary: 2D constrained Delaunay triangulation algorithm. Based on the paper "Sweep-line algorithm for constrained Delaunay triangulation" by V. Domiter and and B. Zalik Properties: - Creates triangles with a large interior angle. - Supports holes - Generate a lot of garbage due to incapsulation of the Poly2Tri library. - Running time is O(n^2), n = number of vertices. - Does not care about winding order. Source: http://code.google.com/p/poly2tri/

member.summary: When we need to traverse from one triangle to the next we need the point in current triangle that is the opposite point to the next triangle.

a point shared by both triangles

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Tools.Triangulation.Delaunay.TriangulationUtil.Epsilon
member.summary: The epsilon

Requirements: 1. a,b and c form a triangle. 2. a and d is know to be on opposite side of bc
a + / \ / \ b/ \c +-------+ / B \ / \
Facts: d has to be in area B to have a chance to be inside the circle formed by a,b and c d is outside B if orient2d(a,b,d) or orient2d(c,a,d) is CW This preknowledge gives us a way to optimize the incircle test
member.returns: true if d is inside circle, false if on circle edge

member.summary: Describes whether in scan area

members.member: Forumla to calculate signed area Positive if CCW Negative if CW 0 if collinear A[P1,P2,P3] = (x1*y2 - y1*x2) + (x2*y3 - y2*x3) + (x3*y1 - y3*x1) = (x1-x3)*(y2-y3) - (y1-y3)*(x2-x3)

member.name: T:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Tools.Triangulation.Earclip.EarclipDecomposer
member.summary: Convex decomposition algorithm using ear clipping Properties: - Only works on simple polygons. - Does not support holes. - Running time is O(n^2), n = number of vertices. Source: http://www.ewjordan.com/earClip/

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Tools.Triangulation.Earclip.EarclipDecomposer.ConvexPartition(Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Shared.Vertices,System.Single)
member.summary: Decompose the polygon into several smaller non-concave polygon. Each resulting polygon will have no more than Settings.MaxPolygonVertices vertices.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Tools.Triangulation.Earclip.EarclipDecomposer.TriangulatePolygon(Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Shared.Vertices,System.Single)
member.summary: Triangulates a polygon using simple ear-clipping algorithm. Returns size of Triangle array unless the polygon can't be triangulated. This should only happen if the polygon self-intersects, though it will not _always_ return null for a bad polygon - it is the caller's responsibility to check for self-intersection, and if it doesn't, it should at least check that the return value is non-null before using. You're warned! Triangles may be degenerate, especially if you have identical points in the input to the algorithm. Check this before you use them. This is totally unoptimized, so for large polygons it should not be part of the simulation loop.
member.remarks: Only works on simple polygons.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Tools.Triangulation.Earclip.EarclipDecomposer.ResolvePinchPoint(Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Shared.Vertices,Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Shared.Vertices@,Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Shared.Vertices@,System.Single)
member.summary: Finds and fixes "pinch points," points where two polygon vertices are at the same point. If a pinch point is found, pin is broken up into poutA and poutB and true is returned; otherwise, returns false. Mostly for internal use. O(N^2) time, which sucks...

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Tools.Triangulation.Earclip.EarclipDecomposer.Remainder(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Fix for obnoxious behavior for the % operator for negative numbers...

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Tools.Triangulation.Earclip.EarclipDecomposer.IsEar(System.Int32,System.Single[],System.Single[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Checks if vertex i is the tip of an ear in polygon defined by xv[] and yv[].
member.remarks: Assumes clockwise orientation of polygon.
member.returns: true if the specified i is ear; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Tools.Triangulation.Seidel.SeidelDecomposer
member.summary: Convex decomposition algorithm created by Raimund Seidel Properties: - Decompose the polygon into trapezoids, then triangulate. - To use the trapezoid data, use ConvexPartitionTrapezoid() - Generate a lot of garbage due to incapsulation of the Poly2Tri library. - Running time is O(n log n), n = number of vertices. - Running time is almost linear for most simple polygons. - Does not care about winding order. For more information, see Raimund Seidel's paper "A simple and fast incremental randomized algorithm for computing trapezoidal decompositions and for triangulating polygons" See also: "Computational Geometry", 3rd edition, by Mark de Berg et al, Chapter 6.2 "Computational Geometry in C", 2nd edition, by Joseph O'Rourke Original code from the Poly2Tri project by Mason Green. http://code.google.com/p/poly2tri/source/browse?repo=archive#hg/scala/src/org/poly2tri/seidel This implementation is from Dec 14, 2010

member.summary: Decompose the polygon into several smaller non-concave polygons.
member.param: The sheer to use if you get bad results, try using a higher value.

member.name: T:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Tools.Triangulation.TriangulationBase.TriangulationAlgorithm
member.summary: The triangulation algorithm enum

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Tools.Triangulation.TriangulationBase.TriangulationAlgorithm.Earclip
member.summary: Convex decomposition algorithm using ear clipping Properties: - Only works on simple polygons. - Does not support holes. - Running time is O(n^2), n = number of vertices.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Tools.Triangulation.TriangulationBase.TriangulationAlgorithm.Bayazit
member.summary: Convex decomposition algorithm created by Mark Bayazit (http://mnbayazit.com/) Properties: - Tries to decompose using polygons instead of triangles. - Tends to produce optimal results with low processing time. - Running time is O(nr), n = number of vertices, r = reflex vertices. - Does not support holes.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Tools.Triangulation.TriangulationBase.TriangulationAlgorithm.Flipcode
member.summary: Convex decomposition algorithm created by unknown Properties: - No support for holes - Very fast - Only works on simple polygons - Only works on counter clockwise polygons

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Tools.Triangulation.TriangulationBase.TriangulationAlgorithm.Seidel
member.summary: Convex decomposition algorithm created by Raimund Seidel Properties: - Decompose the polygon into trapezoids, then triangulate. - To use the trapezoid data, use ConvexPartitionTrapezoid() - Generate a lot of garbage due to incapsulation of the Poly2Tri library. - Running time is O(n log n), n = number of vertices. - Running time is almost linear for most simple polygons. - Does not care about winding order.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Tools.Triangulation.TriangulationBase.TriangulationAlgorithm.SeidelTrapezoids
member.summary: The seidel trapezoids triangulation algorithm

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Tools.Triangulation.TriangulationBase.TriangulationAlgorithm.Delauny
member.summary: 2D constrained Delaunay triangulation algorithm. Based on the paper "Sweep-line algorithm for constrained Delaunay triangulation" by V. Domiter and and B. Zalik Properties: - Creates triangles with a large interior angle. - Supports holes - Generate a lot of garbage due to incapsulation of the Poly2Tri library. - Running time is O(n^2), n = number of vertices. - Does not care about winding order.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Utilities.LineUtils.LineIntersect(System.Numerics.Vector2@,System.Numerics.Vector2@,System.Numerics.Vector2@,System.Numerics.Vector2@,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Numerics.Vector2@)
member.summary: This method detects if two line segments (or lines) intersect, and, if so, the point of intersection. Use the and parameters to set whether the intersection point must be on the first and second line segments. Setting these both to true means you are doing a line-segment to line-segment intersection. Setting one of them to true means you are doing a line to line-segment intersection test, and so on. Note: If two line segments are coincident, then no intersection is detected (there are actually infinite intersection points). Author: Jeremy Bell
member.param: The first point of the first line segment.
The second point of the first line segment.
The first point of the second line segment.
The second point of the second line segment.
This is set to the intersection point if an intersection is detected.
Set this to true to require that the intersection point be on the first line segment.
Set this to true to require that the intersection point be on the second line segment.
member.returns: True if an intersection is detected, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Utilities.LineUtils.LineSegmentVerticesIntersect(System.Numerics.Vector2@,System.Numerics.Vector2@,Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Shared.Vertices)
member.summary: Get all intersections between a line segment and a list of vertices representing a polygon. The vertices reuse adjacent points, so for example edges one and two are between the first and second vertices and between the second and third vertices. The last edge is between vertex vertices.Count - 1 and verts0. (ie, vertices from a Geometry or AABB)
member.param: The first point of the line segment to test
The second point of the line segment to test.

The coordinate on the same axis of vertex 2 of the defining triangle.

The normalized barycentric (areal) coordinate b2, equal to the weighting factor for vertex 2, the coordinate of which is specified in value2.
The normalized barycentric (areal) coordinate b3, equal to the weighting factor for vertex 3, the coordinate of which is specified in value3.
member.returns: Cartesian coordinate of the specified point with respect to the axis being used.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Utilities.MathHelper.Lerp(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Linearly interpolates between two values.
member.param: Value between 0 and 1 indicating the weight of value2.
member.remarks: This method performs the linear interpolation based on the following formula: value1 + (value2 - value1) * amount. Passing amount a value of 0 will cause value1 to be returned, a value of 1 will cause value2 to be returned. See for a less efficient version with more precision around edge cases.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Utilities.MathHelper.LerpPrecise(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Linearly interpolates between two values. This method is a less efficient, more precise version of . See remarks for more info.
member.param: Value between 0 and 1 indicating the weight of value2.
member.remarks: This method performs the linear interpolation based on the following formula: ((1 - amount) * value1) + (value2 * amount). Passing amount a value of 0 will cause value1 to be returned, a value of 1 will cause value2 to be returned. This method does not have the floating point precision issue that has. i.e. If there is a big gap between value1 and value2 in magnitude (e.g. value1=10000000000000000, value2=1), right at the edge of the interpolation range (amount=1), will return 0 (whereas it should return 1). This also holds for value1=10^17, value2=10; value1=10^18,value2=10^2... so on. For an in depth explanation of the issue, see below references: Relevant Wikipedia Article: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Linear_interpolation#Programming_language_support Relevant StackOverflow Answer: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/4353525/floating-point-linear-interpolation#answer-23716956

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.World.RayCast(System.Func{Alis.Core.Systems.Physics2D.Dynamics.Fixture,System.Numerics.Vector2,System.Numerics.Vector2,System.Single,System.Single},System.Numerics.Vector2,System.Numerics.Vector2)
member.summary: Ray-cast the world for all fixtures in the path of the ray. Your callback controls whether you get the closest point, any point, or n-points. The ray-cast ignores shapes that contain the starting point. Inside the callback: return -1: ignore this fixture and continue return 0: terminate the ray cast return fraction: clip the ray to this point return 1: don't clip the ray and continue

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Audio2D.AL.GetError
member.summary: Error support. Obtain the most recent error generated in the AL state machine. When an error is detected by AL, a flag is set and the error code is recorded. Further errors, if they occur, do not affect this recorded code. When alGetError is called, the code is returned and the flag is cleared, so that a further error will again record its code.
member.returns: The first error that occured. can be used with AL.GetString. Returns an Alenum representing the error state. When an OpenAL error occurs, the error state is set and will not be changed until the error state is retrieved using alGetError. Whenever alGetError is called, the error state is cleared and the last state (the current state when the call was made) is returned. To isolate error detection to a specific portion of code, alGetError should be called before the isolated section to clear the current error state.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Audio2D.AL.IsExtensionPresent(System.String)
member.summary: This function tests if a specific Extension is available for the OpenAL driver.
member.param: A string naming the desired extension. Example: "EAX-RAM".
member.returns: Returns True if the Extension is available or False if not available.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Audio2D.AL.GetProcAddress(System.String)
member.summary: This function returns the address of an OpenAL extension function. Handle with care.
member.param: A string containing the function name.
member.returns: The return value is a pointer to the specified function. The return value will be IntPtr.Zero if the function is not found.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Audio2D.AL.GetEnumValue(System.String)
member.summary: This function returns the enumeration value of an OpenAL token, described by a string.
member.param: A string describing an OpenAL token. Example "AL_DISTANCE_MODEL".
member.returns: Returns the actual ALenum described by a string. Returns 0 if the string doesn’t describe a valid OpenAL token.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Audio2D.AL.SourcePlay(System.Int32,System.Int32*)
member.summary: This function plays a set of sources. The playing sources will have their state changed to ALSourceState.Playing. When called on a source which is already playing, the source will restart at the beginning. When the attached buffer(s) are done playing, the source will progress to the ALSourceState.Stopped state.
member.param: The number of sources to be played.
A pointer to an array of sources to be played.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Audio2D.AL.SourcePlay(System.Int32)
member.summary: This function plays, replays or resumes a source. The playing source will have it's state changed to ALSourceState.Playing. When called on a source which is already playing, the source will restart at the beginning. When the attached buffer(s) are done playing, the source will progress to the ALSourceState.Stopped state.
member.param: The name of the source to be played.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Audio2D.AL.SourceStop(System.Int32)
member.summary: This function stops a source. The stopped source will have it's state changed to ALSourceState.Stopped.
member.param: The name of the source to be stopped.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Audio2D.AL.SourceRewind(System.Int32)
member.summary: This function stops the source and sets its state to ALSourceState.Initial.
member.param: The name of the source to be rewound.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Audio2D.AL.SourcePause(System.Int32)
member.summary: This function pauses a source. The paused source will have its state changed to ALSourceState.Paused.
member.param: The name of the source to be paused.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Audio2D.AL.SourceQueueBuffers(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32*)
member.summary: This function queues a set of buffers on a source. All buffers attached to a source will be played in sequence, and the number of processed buffers can be detected using AL.GetSource with parameter ALGetSourcei.BuffersProcessed. When first created, a source will be of type ALSourceType.Undetermined. A successful AL.SourceQueueBuffers call will change the source type to ALSourceType.Streaming.
member.param: The name of the source to queue buffers onto.
The number of buffers to be queued.
A pointer to an array of buffer names to be queued.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Audio2D.AL.SourceQueueBuffers(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32[])
member.summary: This function queues a set of buffers on a source. All buffers attached to a source will be played in sequence, and the number of processed buffers can be detected using AL.GetSource with parameter ALGetSourcei.BuffersProcessed. When first created, a source will be of type ALSourceType.Undetermined. A successful AL.SourceQueueBuffers call will change the source type to ALSourceType.Streaming.
member.param: The name of the source to queue buffers onto.
The number of buffers to be queued.
A pointer to an array of buffer names to be queued.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Audio2D.AL.SourceQueueBuffers(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32@)

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Audio2D.AL.SourceQueueBuffer(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: This function queues a set of buffers on a source. All buffers attached to a source will be played in sequence, and the number of processed buffers can be detected using AL.GetSource with parameter ALGetSourcei.BuffersProcessed. When first created, a source will be of type ALSourceType.Undetermined. A successful AL.SourceQueueBuffers call will change the source type to ALSourceType.Streaming.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Audio2D.AL.SourceUnqueueBuffers(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32*)
member.summary: This function unqueues a set of buffers attached to a source. The number of processed buffers can be detected using AL.GetSource with parameter ALGetSourcei.BuffersProcessed, which is the maximum number of buffers that can be unqueued using this call. The unqueue operation will only take place if all n buffers can be removed from the queue.
member.param: The name of the source to unqueue buffers from.
The number of buffers to be unqueued.
A pointer to an array of buffer names that were removed.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Audio2D.AL.SourceUnqueueBuffers(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32[])

The unqueue operation will only take place if all n buffers can be removed from the queue.
member.param: The name of the source to unqueue buffers from.
The number of buffers to be unqueued.
A pointer to an array of buffer names that were removed.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Audio2D.AL.GenBuffers(System.Int32,System.Int32*)
member.summary: This function generates one or more buffers, which contain audio buffer (see AL.BufferData). References to buffers are uint values, which are used wherever a buffer reference is needed (in calls such as AL.DeleteBuffers, AL.Source with parameter ALSourcei, AL.SourceQueueBuffers, and AL.SourceUnqueueBuffers).
member.param: The number of buffers to be generated.
Pointer to an array of uint values which will store the names of the new buffers.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Audio2D.AL.GenBuffers(System.Int32)
member.summary: This function generates one or more buffers, which contain audio data (see AL.BufferData). References to buffers are uint values, which are used wherever a buffer reference is needed (in calls such as AL.DeleteBuffers, AL.Source with parameter ALSourcei, AL.SourceQueueBuffers, and AL.SourceUnqueueBuffers).
member.param: The number of buffers to be generated.
member.returns: Pointer to an array of uint values which will store the names of the new buffers.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Audio2D.AL.GenBuffer
member.summary: This function generates one buffer only, which contain audio data (see AL.BufferData). References to buffers are uint values, which are used wherever a buffer reference is needed (in calls such as AL.DeleteBuffers, AL.Source with parameter ALSourcei, AL.SourceQueueBuffers, and AL.SourceUnqueueBuffers).
member.returns: Pointer to an uint value which will store the name of the new buffer.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Audio2D.AL.GenBuffer(System.Int32@)
member.summary: This function generates one buffer only, which contain audio data (see AL.BufferData). References to buffers are uint values, which are used wherever a buffer reference is needed (in calls such as AL.DeleteBuffers, AL.Source with parameter ALSourcei, AL.SourceQueueBuffers, and AL.SourceUnqueueBuffers).
member.param: Pointer to an uint value which will store the names of the new buffer.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Audio2D.AL.DeleteBuffers(System.Int32,System.Int32*)
member.summary: This function deletes one or more buffers, freeing the resources used by the buffer. Buffers which are attached to a source can not be deleted. See AL.Source (ALSourcei) and AL.SourceUnqueueBuffers for information on how to detach a buffer from a source.
member.param: The number of buffers to be deleted.
Pointer to an array of buffer names identifying the buffers to be deleted.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Audio2D.AL.DopplerFactor(System.Single)
member.summary: AL.DopplerFactor is a simple scaling of source and listener velocities to exaggerate or deemphasize the Doppler (pitch) shift resulting from the calculation.
member.param: A negative value will result in an error, the command is then ignored. The default value is 1f. The current setting can be queried using AL.Get with parameter ALGetFloat.SpeedOfSound.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Audio2D.AL.DopplerVelocity(System.Single)
member.summary: This function is deprecated and should not be used.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Audio2D.AL.SpeedOfSound(System.Single)
member.summary: AL.SpeedOfSound allows the application to change the reference (propagation) speed used in the Doppler calculation. The source and listener velocities should be expressed in the same units as the speed of sound.
member.param: A negative or zero value will result in an error, and the command is ignored. Default: 343.3f (appropriate for velocity units of meters and air as the propagation medium). The current setting can be queried using AL.Get with parameter ALGetFloat.SpeedOfSound.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Audio2D.AL.DistanceModel(Alis.Core.Audio2D.ALDistanceModel)
member.summary: This function selects the OpenAL distance model – ALDistanceModel.InverseDistance, ALDistanceModel.InverseDistanceClamped, ALDistanceModel.LinearDistance, ALDistanceModel.LinearDistanceClamped, ALDistanceModel.ExponentDistance, ALDistanceModel.ExponentDistanceClamped, or ALDistanceModel.None. The default distance model in OpenAL is ALDistanceModel.InverseDistanceClamped.
member.remarks: The ALDistanceModel .InverseDistance model works according to the following formula: gain = ALSourcef.ReferenceDistance / (ALSourcef.ReferenceDistance + ALSourcef.RolloffFactor * (distance – ALSourcef.ReferenceDistance)); The ALDistanceModel .InverseDistanceClamped model works according to the following formula: distance = max(distance,ALSourcef.ReferenceDistance); distance = min(distance,ALSourcef.MaxDistance); gain = ALSourcef.ReferenceDistance / (ALSourcef.ReferenceDistance + ALSourcef.RolloffFactor * (distance – ALSourcef.ReferenceDistance)); The ALDistanceModel.LinearDistance model works according to the following formula: distance = min(distance, ALSourcef.MaxDistance) // avoid negative gain gain = (1 – ALSourcef.RolloffFactor * (distance – ALSourcef.ReferenceDistance) / (ALSourcef.MaxDistance – ALSourcef.ReferenceDistance)) The ALDistanceModel.LinearDistanceClamped model works according to the following formula: distance = max(distance, ALSourcef.ReferenceDistance) distance = min(distance, ALSourcef.MaxDistance) gain = (1 – ALSourcef.RolloffFactor * (distance – ALSourcef.ReferenceDistance) / (ALSourcef.MaxDistance – ALSourcef.ReferenceDistance)) The ALDistanceModel.ExponentDistance model works according to the following formula: gain = (distance / ALSourcef.ReferenceDistance) ^ (- ALSourcef.RolloffFactor) The ALDistanceModel.ExponentDistanceClamped model works according to the following formula: distance = max(distance, ALSourcef.ReferenceDistance) distance = min(distance, ALSourcef.MaxDistance) gain = (distance / ALSourcef.ReferenceDistance) ^ (- ALSourcef.RolloffFactor) The ALDistanceModel.None model works according to the following formula: gain = 1f;.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Audio2D.ALC.ProcessContext(Alis.Core.Audio2D.ALContext)
member.summary: This function tells a context to begin processing. When a context is suspended, changes in OpenAL state will be accepted but will not be processed. alcSuspendContext can be used to suspend a context, and then all the OpenAL state changes can be applied at once, followed by a call to alcProcessContext to apply all the state changes immediately. In some cases, this procedure may be more efficient than application of properties in a non-suspended state. In some implementations, process and suspend calls are each a NOP.
member.param: A pointer to the new context.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Audio2D.ALC.SuspendContext(Alis.Core.Audio2D.ALContext)
member.summary: This function suspends processing on a specified context. When a context is suspended, changes in OpenAL state will be accepted but will not be processed. A typical use of alcSuspendContext would be to suspend a context, apply all the OpenAL state changes at once, and then call alcProcessContext to apply all the state changes at once. In some cases, this procedure may be more efficient than application of properties in a non-suspended state. In some implementations, process and suspend calls are each a NOP.
member.param: A pointer to the context to be suspended.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Audio2D.ALC.GetStringPtr(Alis.Core.Audio2D.ALDevice,Alis.Core.Audio2D.AlcGetString)
member.summary: This strings related to the context.
member.remarks: ALC_DEFAULT_DEVICE_SPECIFIER will return the name of the default output device. ALC_CAPTURE_DEFAULT_DEVICE_SPECIFIER will return the name of the default capture device. ALC_DEVICE_SPECIFIER will return the name of the specified output device if a pointer is supplied, or will return a list of all available devices if a NULL device pointer is supplied. A list is a pointer to a series of strings separated by NULL characters, with the list terminated by two NULL characters. See Enumeration Extension for more details. ALC_CAPTURE_DEVICE_SPECIFIER will return the name of the specified capture device if a pointer is supplied, or will return a list of all available devices if a NULL device pointer is supplied. ALC_EXTENSIONS returns a list of available context extensions, with each extension separated by a space and the list terminated by a NULL character.
member.param: A pointer to the device to be queried.
An attribute to be retrieved: ALC_DEFAULT_DEVICE_SPECIFIER, ALC_CAPTURE_DEFAULT_DEVICE_SPECIFIER, ALC_DEVICE_SPECIFIER, ALC_CAPTURE_DEVICE_SPECIFIER, ALC_EXTENSIONS.
member.returns: A string containing the name of the Device.

A list is a pointer to a series of strings separated by NULL characters, with the list terminated by two NULL characters. See Enumeration Extension for more details. ALC_CAPTURE_DEVICE_SPECIFIER will return the name of the specified capture device if a pointer is supplied, or will return a list of all available devices if a NULL device pointer is supplied. ALC_EXTENSIONS returns a list of available context extensions, with each extension separated by a space and the list terminated by a NULL character.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Audio2D.ALC.CaptureStart(Alis.Core.Audio2D.ALCaptureDevice)
member.summary: This function begins a capture operation.
member.remarks: alcCaptureStart will begin recording to an internal ring buffer of the size specified when opening the capture device. The application can then retrieve the number of samples currently available using the ALC_CAPTURE_SAPMPLES token with alcGetIntegerv. When the application determines that enough samples are available for processing, then it can obtain them with a call to alcCaptureSamples.
member.param: A pointer to a capture device.

member.summary: This function stops a capture operation.
member.param: A pointer to a capture device.

member.name: T:Alis.Core.Audio2D.ALListenerf
member.summary: A list of valid 32-bit Float Listener/GetListener parameters.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.ALListenerf.Gain
member.summary: Indicate the gain (Volume amplification) applied. Type: float Range: [0.0f - ? ] A value of 1.0 means un-attenuated/unchanged. Each division by 2 equals an attenuation of -6dB. Each multiplicaton with 2 equals an amplification of +6dB. A value of 0.0f is interpreted as zero volume and the channel is effectively disabled.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.ALListenerf.EfxMetersPerUnit
member.summary: (EFX Extension) This setting is critical if Air Absorption effects are enabled because the amount of Air Absorption applied is directly related to the real-world distance between the Source and the Listener. centimeters 0.01f meters 1.0f kilometers 1000.0f Range [float.MinValue .. float.MaxValue] Default: 1.0f

member.name: T:Alis.Core.Audio2D.ALListener3f
member.summary: A list of valid Math.Vector3 Listener/GetListener parameters.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.ALListener3f.Position
member.summary: Specify the current location in three dimensional space. OpenAL, like OpenGL, uses a right handed coordinate system, where in a frontal default view X (thumb) points right, Y points up (index finger), and Z points towards the viewer/camera (middle finger). To switch from a left handed coordinate system, flip the sign on the Z coordinate. Listener position is always in the world coordinate system.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.ALListener3f.Velocity
member.summary: Specify the current velocity in three dimensional space.

member.name: T:Alis.Core.Audio2D.ALListenerfv
member.summary: A list of valid float[] Listener/GetListener parameters.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.ALListenerfv.Orientation
member.summary: Indicate Listener orientation. Expects two Vector3, At followed by Up.

member.name: T:Alis.Core.Audio2D.ALSourcef
member.summary: A list of valid 32-bit Float Source/GetSource parameters.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.ALSourcef.ReferenceDistance
member.summary: Source specific reference distance. Type: float Range: [0.0f - float.PositiveInfinity] At 0.0f, no distance attenuation occurs. Type: float Default: 1.0f.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.ALSourcef.MaxDistance
member.summary: Indicate distance above which Sources are not attenuated using the inverse clamped distance model. Default: float.PositiveInfinity Type: float Range: [0.0f - float.PositiveInfinity]

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.ALSourcef.RolloffFactor
member.summary: Source specific rolloff factor. Type: float Range: [0.0f - float.PositiveInfinity]

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.ALSourcef.Pitch
member.summary: Specify the pitch to be applied, either at Source, or on mixer results, at Listener. Range: [0.5f - 2.0f] Default: 1.0f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.ALSourcef.Gain
member.summary: Indicate the gain (volume amplification) applied. Type: float. Range: [0.0f - ? ] A value of 1.0 means un-attenuated/unchanged. Each division by 2 equals an attenuation of -6dB. Each multiplicaton with 2 equals an amplification of +6dB. A value of 0.0f is meaningless with respect to a logarithmic scale; it is interpreted as zero volume - the channel is effectively disabled.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.ALSourcef.MinGain
member.summary: Indicate minimum Source attenuation. Type: float Range: [0.0f - 1.0f] (Logarthmic)

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.ALSourcef.MaxGain
member.summary: Indicate maximum Source attenuation. Type: float Range: [0.0f - 1.0f] (Logarthmic)

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.ALSourcef.ConeInnerAngle
member.summary: Directional Source, inner cone angle, in degrees. Range: [0-360] Default: 360

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.ALSourcef.ConeOuterAngle
member.summary: Directional Source, outer cone angle, in degrees. Range: [0-360] Default: 360

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.ALSourcef.ConeOuterGain
member.summary: Directional Source, outer cone gain. Default: 0.0f Range: [0.0f - 1.0] (Logarithmic)

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.ALSourcef.SecOffset
member.summary: The playback position, expressed in seconds.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.ALSourcef.EfxAirAbsorptionFactor
member.summary: (EFX Extension) This property is a multiplier on the amount of Air Absorption applied to the Source. The AL_AIR_ABSORPTION_FACTOR is multiplied by an internal Air Absorption Gain HF value of 0.994 (-0.05dB) per meter which represents normal atmospheric humidity and temperature. Range [0.0f .. 10.0f] Default: 0.0f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.ALSourcef.EfxRoomRolloffFactor
member.summary: (EFX Extension) This property is defined the same way as the Reverb Room Rolloff property: it is one of two methods available in the Effect Extension to attenuate the reflected sound (early reflections and reverberation) according to source-listener distance. Range [0.0f .. 10.0f] Default: 0.0f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.ALSourcef.EfxConeOuterGainHighFrequency
member.summary: (EFX Extension) A directed Source points in a specified direction. The Source sounds at full volume when the listener is directly in front of the source; it is attenuated as the listener circles the Source away from the front. Range [0.0f .. 1.0f] Default: 1.0f

member.name: T:Alis.Core.Audio2D.ALSource3f
member.summary: A list of valid Math.Vector3 Source/GetSource parameters.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.ALSource3f.Position
member.summary: Specify the current location in three dimensional space. OpenAL, like OpenGL, uses a right handed coordinate system, where in a frontal default view X (thumb) points right, Y points up (index finger), and Z points towards the viewer/camera (middle finger). To switch from a left handed coordinate system, flip the sign on the Z coordinate. Listener position is always in the world coordinate system.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.ALSource3f.Velocity
member.summary: Specify the current velocity in three dimensional space.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.ALSource3f.Direction
member.summary: Specify the current direction vector.

member.name: T:Alis.Core.Audio2D.ALSourceb
member.summary: A list of valid 8-bit boolean Source/GetSource parameters.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.ALSourceb.SourceRelative
member.summary: Indicate that the Source has relative coordinates. Type: bool Range: [True, False]

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.ALSourceb.Looping
member.summary: Indicate whether the Source is looping. Type: bool Range: [True, False] Default: False.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.ALSourceb.EfxDirectFilterGainHighFrequencyAuto
member.summary: (EFX Extension) If this Source property is set to True, this Source’s direct-path is automatically filtered according to the orientation of the source relative to the listener and the setting of the Source property Sourcef.ConeOuterGainHF. Type: bool Range [False, True] Default: True

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.ALSourceb.EfxAuxiliarySendFilterGainAuto
member.summary: (EFX Extension) If this Source property is set to True, the intensity of this Source’s reflected sound is automatically attenuated according to source-listener distance and source directivity (as determined by the cone parameters). If it is False, the reflected sound is not attenuated according to distance and directivity. Type: bool Range [False, True] Default: True

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.ALSourceb.EfxAuxiliarySendFilterGainHighFrequencyAuto
member.summary: (EFX Extension) If this Source property is AL_TRUE (its default value), the intensity of this Source’s reflected sound at high frequencies will be automatically attenuated according to the high-frequency source directivity as set by the Sourcef.ConeOuterGainHF property. If this property is AL_FALSE, the Source’s reflected sound is not filtered at all according to the Source’s directivity. Type: bool Range [False, True] Default: True

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.ALSource3i.Position
member.summary: Specify the current location in three dimensional space. OpenAL, like OpenGL, uses a right handed coordinate system, where in a frontal default view X (thumb) points right, Y points up (index finger), and Z points towards the viewer/camera (middle finger). To switch from a left handed coordinate system, flip the sign on the Z coordinate. Listener position is always in the world coordinate system.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.ALSource3i.Velocity
member.summary: Specify the current velocity in three dimensional space.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.ALSource3i.Direction
member.summary: Specify the current direction vector.
