member.name: T:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat
member.summary: A list of valid 32-bit Float Effect/GetEffect parameters.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat.ReverbDensity
member.summary: Reverb Modal Density controls the coloration of the late reverb. Lowering the value adds more coloration to the late reverb. Range [0.0f .. 1.0f] Default: 1.0f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat.ReverbDiffusion
member.summary: The Reverb Diffusion property controls the echo density in the reverberation decay. The default 1.0f provides the highest density. Reducing diffusion gives the reverberation a more "grainy" character that is especially noticeable with percussive sound sources. If you set a diffusion value of 0.0f, the later reverberation sounds like a succession of distinct echoes. Range [0.0f .. 1.0f] Default: 1.0f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat.ReverbGain
member.summary: The Reverb Gain property is the master volume control for the reflected sound - both early reflections and reverberation - that the reverb effect adds to all sound sources. Ranges from 1.0 (0db) (the maximum amount) to 0.0 (-100db) (no reflected sound at all) are accepted. Units: Linear gain Range [0.0f .. 1.0f] Default: 0.32f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat.ReverbGainHF
member.summary: The Reverb Gain HF property further tweaks reflected sound by attenuating it at high frequencies. It controls a low-pass filter that applies globally to the reflected sound of all sound sources feeding the particular instance of the reverb effect. Ranges from 1.0f (0db) (no filter) to 0.0f (-100db) (virtually no reflected sound) are accepted. Units: Linear gain Range [0.0f .. 1.0f] Default: 0.89f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat.ReverbDecayTime
member.summary: The Decay Time property sets the reverberation decay time. It ranges from 0.1f (typically a small room with very dead surfaces) to 20.0 (typically a large room with very live surfaces). Unit: Seconds Range [0.1f .. 20.0f] Default: 1.49f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat.ReverbDecayHFRatio
member.summary: The Decay HF Ratio property sets the spectral quality of the Decay Time parameter. It is the ratio of high-frequency decay time relative to the time set by Decay Time.. Unit: linear multiplier Range [0.1f .. 2.0f] Default: 0.83f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat.ReverbReflectionsGain
member.summary: The Reflections Gain property controls the overall amount of initial reflections relative to the Gain property. The value of Reflections Gain ranges from a maximum of 3.16f (+10 dB) to a minimum of 0.0f (-100 dB) (no initial reflections at all), and is corrected by the value of the Gain property. Unit: Linear gain Range [0.0f .. 3.16f] Default: 0.05f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat.ReverbReflectionsDelay
member.summary: The Reflections Delay property is the amount of delay between the arrival time of the direct path from the source to the first reflection from the source. It ranges from 0 to 300 milliseconds. Unit: Seconds Range [0.0f .. 0.3f] Default: 0.007f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat.ReverbLateReverbGain
member.summary: The Late Reverb Gain property controls the overall amount of later reverberation relative to the Gain property. The value of Late Reverb Gain ranges from a maximum of 10.0f (+20 dB) to a minimum of 0.0f (-100 dB) (no late reverberation at all). Unit: Linear gain Range [0.0f .. 10.0f] Default: 1.26f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat.ReverbLateReverbDelay
member.summary: The Late Reverb Delay property defines the begin time of the late reverberation relative to the time of the initial reflection (the first of the early reflections). It ranges from 0 to 100 milliseconds. Unit: Seconds Range [0.0f .. 0.1f] Default: 0.011f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat.ReverbAirAbsorptionGainHF
member.summary: The Air Absorption Gain HF property controls the distance-dependent attenuation at high frequencies caused by the propagation medium and applies to reflected sound only. Unit: Linear gain per meter Range [0.892f .. 1.0f] Default: 0.994f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat.ReverbRoomRolloffFactor
member.summary: The Room Rolloff Factor property is one of two methods available to attenuate the reflected sound (containing both reflections and reverberation) according to source-listener distance. It's defined the same way as OpenAL's Rolloff Factor, but operates on reverb sound instead of direct-path sound. Unit: Linear multiplier Range [0.0f .. 10.0f] Default: 0.0f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat.ChorusRate
member.summary: This property sets the modulation rate of the low-frequency oscillator that controls the delay time of the delayed signals. Unit: Hz Range [0.0f .. 10.0f] Default: 1.1f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat.ChorusDepth
member.summary: This property controls the amount by which the delay time is modulated by the low-frequency oscillator. Range [0.0f .. 1.0f] Default: 0.1f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat.ChorusFeedback
member.summary: This property controls the amount of processed signal that is fed back to the input of the chorus effect. Negative values will reverse the phase of the feedback signal. At full magnitude the identical sample will repeat endlessly. Range [-1.0f .. +1.0f] Default: +0.25f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat.ChorusDelay
member.summary: This property controls the average amount of time the sample is delayed before it is played back, and with feedback, the amount of time between iterations of the sample. Larger values lower the pitch. Unit: Seconds Range [0.0f .. 0.016f] Default: 0.016f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat.DistortionEdge
member.summary: This property controls the shape of the distortion. The higher the value for Edge, the "dirtier" and "fuzzier" the effect. Range [0.0f .. 1.0f] Default: 0.2f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat.DistortionGain
member.summary: This property allows you to attenuate the distorted sound. Range [0.01f .. 1.0f] Default: 0.05f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat.DistortionLowpassCutoff
member.summary: Input signals can have a low pass filter applied, to limit the amount of high frequency signal feeding into the distortion effect. Unit: Hz Range [80.0f .. 24000.0f] Default: 8000.0f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat.DistortionEQCenter
member.summary: This property controls the frequency at which the post-distortion attenuation (Distortion Gain) is active. Unit: Hz Range [80.0f .. 24000.0f] Default: 3600.0f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat.DistortionEQBandwidth
member.summary: This property controls the bandwidth of the post-distortion attenuation. Unit: Hz Range [80.0f .. 24000.0f] Default: 3600.0f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat.EchoDelay
member.summary: This property controls the delay between the original sound and the first "tap", or echo instance. Subsequently, the value for Echo Delay is used to determine the time delay between each "second tap" and the next "first tap". Unit: Seconds Range [0.0f .. 0.207f] Default: 0.1f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat.EchoLRDelay
member.summary: This property controls the delay between the "first tap" and the "second tap". Subsequently, the value for Echo LR Delay is used to determine the time delay between each "first tap" and the next "second tap". Unit: Seconds Range [0.0f .. 0.404f] Default: 0.1f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat.EchoDamping
member.summary: This property controls the amount of high frequency damping applied to each echo. As the sound is subsequently fed back for further echoes, damping results in an echo which progressively gets softer in tone as well as intensity. Range [0.0f .. 0.99f] Default: 0.5f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat.EchoFeedback
member.summary: This property controls the amount of feedback the output signal fed back into the input. Use this parameter to create "cascading" echoes. At full magnitude, the identical sample will repeat endlessly. Below full magnitude, the sample will repeat and fade. Range [0.0f .. 1.0f] Default: 0.5f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat.EchoSpread
member.summary: This property controls how hard panned the individual echoes are. With a value of 1.0f, the first "tap" will be panned hard left, and the second "tap" hard right. –1.0f gives the opposite result and values near to 0.0f result in less emphasized panning. Range [-1.0f .. +1.0f] Default: -1.0f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat.FlangerRate
member.summary: The number of times per second the low-frequency oscillator controlling the amount of delay repeats. Range [0.0f .. 10.0f] Default: 0.27f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat.FlangerDepth
member.summary: The ratio by which the delay time is modulated by the low-frequency oscillator. Range [0.0f .. 1.0f] Default: 1.0f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat.FlangerFeedback
member.summary: This is the amount of the output signal level fed back into the effect's input. A negative value will reverse the phase of the feedback signal. Range [-1.0f .. +1.0f] Default: -0.5f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat.FlangerDelay
member.summary: The average amount of time the sample is delayed before it is played back. When used with the Feedback property it's the amount of time between iterations of the sample. Unit: Seconds Range [0.0f .. 0.004f] Default: 0.002f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat.FrequencyShifterFrequency
member.summary: This is the carrier frequency. For carrier frequencies below the audible range, the single sideband modulator may produce phaser effects, spatial effects or a slight pitch-shift. As the carrier frequency increases, the timbre of the sound is affected. Unit: Hz Range [0.0f .. 24000.0f] Default: 0.0f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat.VocalMorpherRate
member.summary: This controls the frequency of the low-frequency oscillator used to morph between the two phoneme filters. Unit: Hz Range [0.0f .. 10.0f] Default: 1.41f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat.RingModulatorFrequency
member.summary: This is the frequency of the carrier signal. If the carrier signal is slowly varying (less than 20 Hz), the result is a slow amplitude variation effect (tremolo). Unit: Hz Range [0.0f .. 8000.0f] Default: 440.0f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat.RingModulatorHighpassCutoff
member.summary: This controls the cutoff frequency at which the input signal is high-pass filtered before being ring modulated. Unit: Hz Range [0.0f .. 24000.0f] Default: 800.0f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat.AutowahAttackTime
member.summary: This property controls the time the filtering effect takes to sweep from minimum to maximum center frequency when it is triggered by input signal. Unit: Seconds Range [0.0001f .. 1.0f] Default: 0.06f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat.AutowahReleaseTime
member.summary: This property controls the time the filtering effect takes to sweep from maximum back to base center frequency, when the input signal ends. Unit: Seconds Range [0.0001f .. 1.0f] Default: 0.06f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat.AutowahResonance
member.summary: This property controls the resonant peak, sometimes known as emphasis or Q, of the auto-wah band-pass filter. Range [2.0f .. 1000.0f] Default: 1000.0f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat.AutowahPeakGain
member.summary: This property controls the input signal level at which the band-pass filter will be fully opened. Range [0.00003f .. 31621.0f] Default: 11.22f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat.EqualizerLowGain
member.summary: This property controls amount of cut or boost on the low frequency range. Range [0.126f .. 7.943f] Default: 1.0f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat.EqualizerLowCutoff
member.summary: This property controls the low frequency below which signal will be cut off. Unit: Hz Range [50.0f .. 800.0f] Default: 200.0f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat.EqualizerMid1Gain
member.summary: This property allows you to cut/boost signal on the "mid1" range. Range [0.126f .. 7.943f] Default: 1.0f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat.EqualizerMid1Center
member.summary: This property sets the center frequency for the "mid1" range. Unit: Hz Range [200.0f .. 3000.0f] Default: 500.0f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat.EqualizerMid1Width
member.summary: This property controls the width of the "mid1" range. Range [0.01f .. 1.0f] Default: 1.0f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat.EqualizerMid2Gain
member.summary: This property allows you to cut/boost signal on the "mid2" range. Range [0.126f .. 7.943f] Default: 1.0f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat.EqualizerMid2Center
member.summary: This property sets the center frequency for the "mid2" range. Unit: Hz Range [1000.0f .. 8000.0f] Default: 3000.0f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat.EqualizerMid2Width
member.summary: This property controls the width of the "mid2" range. Range [0.01f .. 1.0f] Default: 1.0f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat.EqualizerHighGain
member.summary: This property allows to cut/boost the signal at high frequencies. Range [0.126f .. 7.943f] Default: 1.0f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat.EqualizerHighCutoff
member.summary: This property controls the high frequency above which signal will be cut off. Unit: Hz Range [4000.0f .. 16000.0f] Default: 6000.0f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat.EaxReverbDensity
member.summary: Reverb Modal Density controls the coloration of the late reverb. Range [0.0f .. 1.0f] Default: 1.0f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat.EaxReverbDiffusion
member.summary: The Reverb Diffusion property controls the echo density in the reverberation decay. Range [0.0f .. 1.0f] Default: 1.0f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat.EaxReverbGain
member.summary: Reverb Gain controls the level of the reverberant sound in an environment. A high level of reverb is characteristic of rooms with highly reflective walls and/or small dimensions. Unit: Linear gain Range [0.0f .. 1.0f] Default: 0.32f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat.EaxReverbGainHF
member.summary: Gain HF is used to attenuate the high frequency content of all the reflected sound in an environment. You can use this property to give a room specific spectral characteristic. Unit: Linear gain Range [0.0f .. 1.0f] Default: 0.89f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat.EaxReverbGainLF
member.summary: Gain LF is the low frequency counterpart to Gain HF. Use this to reduce or boost the low frequency content in an environment. Unit: Linear gain Range [0.0f .. 1.0f] Default: 1.0f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat.EaxReverbDecayTime
member.summary: The Decay Time property sets the reverberation decay time. It ranges from 0.1f (typically a small room with very dead surfaces) to 20.0f (typically a large room with very live surfaces). Unit: Seconds Range [0.1f .. 20.0f] Default: 1.49f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat.EaxReverbDecayHFRatio
member.summary: Decay HF Ratio scales the decay time of high frequencies relative to the value of the Decay Time property. By changing this value, you are changing the amount of time it takes for the high frequencies to decay compared to the mid frequencies of the reverb. Range [0.1f .. 2.0f] Default: 0.83f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat.EaxReverbDecayLFRatio
member.summary: Decay LF Ratio scales the decay time of low frequencies in the reverberation in the same manner that Decay HF Ratio handles high frequencies. Unit: Linear multiplier Range [0.1f .. 2.0f] Default: 1.0f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat.EaxReverbReflectionsGain
member.summary: Reflections Gain sets the level of the early reflections in an environment. Early reflections are used as a cue for determining the size of the environment we are in. Unit: Linear gain Range [0.0f .. 3.16f] Default: 0.05f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat.EaxReverbReflectionsDelay
member.summary: Reflections Delay controls the amount of time it takes for the first reflected wave front to reach the listener, relative to the arrival of the direct-path sound. Unit: Seconds Range [0.0f .. 0.3f] Default: 0.007f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat.EaxReverbLateReverbGain
member.summary: The Late Reverb Gain property controls the overall amount of later reverberation relative to the Gain property. Range [0.0f .. 10.0f] Default: 1.26f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat.EaxReverbLateReverbDelay
member.summary: The Late Reverb Delay property defines the begin time of the late reverberation relative to the time of the initial reflection (the first of the early reflections). It ranges from 0 to 100 milliseconds. Unit: Seconds Range [0.0f .. 0.1f] Default: 0.011f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat.EaxReverbEchoTime
member.summary: Echo Time controls the rate at which the cyclic echo repeats itself along the reverberation decay. Range [0.075f .. 0.25f] Default: 0.25f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat.EaxReverbEchoDepth
member.summary: Echo Depth introduces a cyclic echo in the reverberation decay, which will be noticeable with transient or percussive sounds. Range [0.0f .. 1.0f] Default: 0.0f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat.EaxReverbModulationTime
member.summary: Modulation Time controls the speed of the rate of periodic changes in pitch (vibrato). Range [0.04f .. 4.0f] Default: 0.25f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat.EaxReverbModulationDepth
member.summary: Modulation Depth controls the amount of pitch change. Low values of Diffusion will contribute to reinforcing the perceived effect by reducing the mixing of overlapping reflections in the reverberation decay. Range [0.0f .. 1.0f] Default: 0.0f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat.EaxReverbAirAbsorptionGainHF
member.summary: The Air Absorption Gain HF property controls the distance-dependent attenuation at high frequencies caused by the propagation medium. It applies to reflected sound only. Range [0.892f .. 1.0f] Default: 0.994f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat.EaxReverbHFReference
member.summary: The property HF reference determines the frequency at which the high-frequency effects created by Reverb properties are measured. Unit: Hz Range [1000.0f .. 20000.0f] Default: 5000.0f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat.EaxReverbLFReference
member.summary: The property LF reference determines the frequency at which the low-frequency effects created by Reverb properties are measured. Unit: Hz Range [20.0f .. 1000.0f] Default: 250.0f

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectFloat.EaxReverbRoomRolloffFactor
member.summary: The Room Rolloff Factor property is one of two methods available to attenuate the reflected sound (containing both reflections and reverberation) according to source-listener distance. It's defined the same way as OpenAL Rolloff Factor, but operates on reverb sound instead of direct-path sound. Range [0.0f .. 10.0f] Default: 0.0f

member.name: T:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectInteger
member.summary: A list of valid Int32 Effect/GetEffect parameters.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectInteger.ChorusWaveform
member.summary: This property sets the waveform shape of the low-frequency oscillator that controls the delay time of the delayed signals. Unit: (0) Sinusoid, (1) Triangle Range [0 .. 1] Default: 1

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectInteger.ChorusPhase
member.summary: This property controls the phase difference between the left and right low-frequency oscillators. At zero degrees the two low-frequency oscillators are synchronized. Unit: Degrees Range [-180 .. 180] Default: 90

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectInteger.FlangerWaveform
member.summary: Selects the shape of the low-frequency oscillator waveform that controls the amount of the delay of the sampled signal. Unit: (0) Sinusoid, (1) Triangle Range [0 .. 1] Default: 1

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectInteger.FlangerPhase
member.summary: This changes the phase difference between the left and right low-frequency oscillator's. At zero degrees the two low-frequency oscillators are synchronized. Range [-180 .. +180] Default: 0

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectInteger.FrequencyShifterLeftDirection
member.summary: These select which internal signals are added together to produce the output. Unit: (0) Down, (1) Up, (2) Off Range [0 .. 2] Default: 0

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectInteger.FrequencyShifterRightDirection
member.summary: These select which internal signals are added together to produce the output. Unit: (0) Down, (1) Up, (2) Off Range [0 .. 2] Default: 0

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectInteger.VocalMorpherPhonemeA
member.summary: Sets the vocal morpher 4-band formant filter A, used to impose vocal tract effects upon the input signal. The vocal morpher is not necessarily intended for use on voice signals; it is primarily intended for pitched noise effects, vocal-like wind effects, etc. Unit: Use enum EfxFormantFilterSettings Range [0 .. 29] Default: 0, "Phoneme A"

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectInteger.VocalMorpherPhonemeACoarseTuning
member.summary: This is used to adjust the pitch of phoneme filter A in 1-semitone increments. Unit: Semitones Range [-24 .. +24] Default: 0

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectInteger.VocalMorpherPhonemeB
member.summary: Sets the vocal morpher 4-band formant filter B, used to impose vocal tract effects upon the input signal. The vocal morpher is not necessarily intended for use on voice signals; it is primarily intended for pitched noise effects, vocal-like wind effects, etc. Unit: Use enum EfxFormantFilterSettings Range [0 .. 29] Default: 10, "Phoneme ER"

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectInteger.VocalMorpherPhonemeBCoarseTuning
member.summary: This is used to adjust the pitch of phoneme filter B in 1-semitone increments. Unit: Semitones Range [-24 .. +24] Default: 0

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectInteger.VocalMorpherWaveform
member.summary: This controls the shape of the low-frequency oscillator used to morph between the two phoneme filters. Unit: (0) Sinusoid, (1) Triangle, (2) Sawtooth Range [0 .. 2] Default: 0

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectInteger.PitchShifterCoarseTune
member.summary: This sets the number of semitones by which the pitch is shifted. There are 12 semitones per octave. Unit: Semitones Range [-12 .. +12] Default: +12

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectInteger.PitchShifterFineTune
member.summary: This sets the number of cents between Semitones a pitch is shifted. A Cent is 1/100th of a Semitone. Unit: Cents Range [-50 .. +50] Default: 0

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectInteger.RingModulatorWaveform
member.summary: This controls which waveform is used as the carrier signal. Traditional ring modulator and tremolo effects generally use a sinusoidal carrier. Unit: (0) Sinusoid, (1) Sawtooth, (2) Square Range [0 .. 2] Default: 0

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectInteger.CompressorOnoff
member.summary: Enabling this will result in audio exhibiting smaller variation in intensity between the loudest and quietest portions. Unit: (0) Off, (1) On Range [0 .. 1] Default: 1

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectInteger.ReverbDecayHFLimit
member.summary: When this flag is set, the high-frequency decay time automatically stays below a limit value that's derived from the setting of the property Air Absorption HF. Unit: (0) False, (1) True Range [False, True] Default: True

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectInteger.EaxReverbDecayHFLimit
member.summary: When this flag is set, the high-frequency decay time automatically stays below a limit value that's derived from the setting of the property AirAbsorptionGainHF. Unit: (0) False, (1) True Range [False, True] Default: True

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectInteger.EffectType
member.summary: Used with the enum EfxEffectType as it's parameter.

member.name: T:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectSlotFloat
member.summary: A list of valid AuxiliaryEffectSlot/GetAuxiliaryEffectSlot parameters.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectSlotFloat.Gain
member.summary: Range [0.0f .. 1.0f] Default: 1.0f This property is used to specify an output level for the Auxiliary Effect Slot. Setting the gain to 0.0f mutes the output.

member.name: T:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectSlotInteger
member.summary: A list of valid AuxiliaryEffectSlot/GetAuxiliaryEffectSlot parameters.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectSlotInteger.Effect
member.summary: This property is used to attach an Effect object to the Auxiliary Effect Slot object. After the attachment, the Auxiliary Effect Slot object will contain the effect type and have the same effect parameters that were stored in the Effect object. Any Sources feeding the Auxiliary Effect Slot will immediate feed the new effect type and new effect parameters.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectSlotInteger.AuxiliarySendAuto
member.summary: This property is used to enable or disable automatic send adjustments based on the physical positions of the sources and the listener. This property should be enabled when an application wishes to use a reverb effect to simulate the environment surrounding a listener or a collection of Sources.

member.name: T:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectType
member.summary: Effect type definitions to be used with EfxEffecti.EffectType.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectType.Null
member.summary: No Effect, disable. This Effect type is used when an Effect object is initially created.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectType.Reverb
member.summary: The Reverb effect is the standard Effects Extension's environmental reverberation effect. It is available on all Generic Software and Generic Hardware devices.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectType.Chorus
member.summary: The Chorus effect essentially replays the input audio accompanied by another slightly delayed version of the signal, creating a "doubling" effect.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectType.Distortion
member.summary: The Distortion effect simulates turning up (overdriving) the gain stage on a guitar amplifier or adding a distortion pedal to an instrument's output.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectType.Echo
member.summary: The Echo effect generates discrete, delayed instances of the input signal.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectType.Flanger
member.summary: The Flanger effect creates a "tearing" or "whooshing" sound, like a jet flying overhead.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectType.FrequencyShifter
member.summary: The Frequency shifter is a single-sideband modulator, which translates all the component frequencies of the input signal by an equal amount.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectType.VocalMorpher
member.summary: The Vocal morpher consists of a pair of 4-band formant filters, used to impose vocal tract effects upon the input signal.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectType.PitchShifter
member.summary: The Pitch shifter applies time-invariant pitch shifting to the input signal, over a one octave range and controllable at a semi-tone and cent resolution.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectType.RingModulator
member.summary: The Ring modulator multiplies an input signal by a carrier signal in the time domain, resulting in tremolo or inharmonic effects.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectType.Autowah
member.summary: The Auto-wah effect emulates the sound of a wah-wah pedal used with an electric guitar, or a mute on a brass instrument.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectType.Compressor
member.summary: The Compressor will boost quieter portions of the audio, while louder portions will stay the same or may even be reduced.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectType.Equalizer
member.summary: The Equalizer is very flexible, providing tonal control over four different adjustable frequency ranges.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectType.EaxReverb
member.summary: The EAX Reverb has a more advanced parameter set than EfxEffectType.Reverb, but is only natively supported on devices that support the EAX 3.0 or above.

member.name: T:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectVector3
member.summary: A list of valid Math.Vector3 Effect/GetEffect parameters.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectVector3.EaxReverbLateReverbPan
member.summary: Reverb Pan does for the Reverb what Reflections Pan does for the Reflections. Unit: Vector3 of length 0f to 1f Default: {0.0f, 0.0f, 0.0f}

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EffectVector3.EaxReverbReflectionsPan
member.summary: This Vector3 controls the spatial distribution of the cluster of early reflections. The direction of this vector controls the global direction of the reflections, while its magnitude controls how focused the reflections are towards this direction. For legacy reasons this Vector3 follows a left-handed co-ordinate system! Note that OpenAL uses a right-handed coordinate system. Unit: Vector3 of length 0f to 1f Default: {0.0f, 0.0f, 0.0f}

member.name: T:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EFXContextAttributes
member.summary: Defines new context attributes.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EFXContextAttributes.MaxAuxiliarySends
member.summary: Default: 2 This Context property can be passed to OpenAL during Context creation (alcCreateContext) to request a maximum number of Auxiliary Sends desired on each Source. It is not guaranteed that the desired number of sends will be available, so an application should query this property after creating the context using alcGetIntergerv.

member.name: T:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EFXContextInteger
member.summary: Defines new integer properties on the OpenAL context.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EFXContextInteger.EFXMajorVersion
member.summary: This property can be used by the application to retrieve the Major version number of the Effects Extension supported by this OpenAL implementation. As this is a Context property is should be retrieved using alcGetIntegerv.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EFXContextInteger.EFXMinorVersion
member.summary: This property can be used by the application to retrieve the Minor version number of the Effects Extension supported by this OpenAL implementation. As this is a Context property is should be retrieved using alcGetIntegerv.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EFXContextInteger.MaxAuxiliarySends
member.summary: Default: 2 This Context property can be passed to OpenAL during Context creation (alcCreateContext) to request a maximum number of Auxiliary Sends desired on each Source. It is not guaranteed that the desired number of sends will be available, so an application should query this property after creating the context using alcGetIntergerv.

member.name: T:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EFXListenerFloat
member.summary: A list of valid Listener/GetListener parameters.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EFXListenerFloat.EfxMetersPerUnit
member.summary: centimeters 0.01f meters 1.0f kilometers 1000.0f Range [float.MinValue .. float.MaxValue] Default: 1.0f. This setting is critical if Air Absorption effects are enabled because the amount of Air Absorption applied is directly related to the real-world distance between the Source and the Listener.

member.name: T:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EFXSourceBoolean
member.summary: A list of valid Source/GetSource parameters.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EFXSourceBoolean.DirectFilterGainHighFrequencyAuto
member.summary: Default: True If this Source property is set to True, this Source’s direct-path is automatically filtered according to the orientation of the source relative to the listener and the setting of the Source property Sourcef.ConeOuterGainHF.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EFXSourceBoolean.AuxiliarySendFilterGainAuto
member.summary: Default: True If this Source property is set to True, the intensity of this Source’s reflected sound is automatically attenuated according to source-listener distance and source directivity (as determined by the cone parameters). If it is False, the reflected sound is not attenuated according to distance and directivity.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EFXSourceBoolean.AuxiliarySendFilterGainHighFrequencyAuto
member.summary: Default: True If this Source property is AL_TRUE (its default value), the intensity of this Source’s reflected sound at high frequencies will be automatically attenuated according to the high-frequency source directivity as set by the Sourcef.ConeOuterGainHF property. If this property is AL_FALSE, the Source’s reflected sound is not filtered at all according to the Source’s directivity.

member.name: T:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EFXSourceFloat
member.summary: A list of valid Source/GetSource parameters.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EFXSourceFloat.AirAbsorptionFactor
member.summary: Range [0.0f .. 10.0f] Default: 0.0f This property is a multiplier on the amount of Air Absorption applied to the Source. The AL_AIR_ABSORPTION_FACTOR is multiplied by an internal Air Absorption Gain HF value of 0.994 (-0.05dB) per meter which represents normal atmospheric humidity and temperature.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EFXSourceFloat.RoomRolloffFactor
member.summary: Range [0.0f .. 10.0f] Default: 0.0f This property is defined the same way as the Reverb Room Rolloff property: it is one of two methods available in the Effect Extension to attenuate the reflected sound (early reflections and reverberation) according to source-listener distance.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EFXSourceFloat.ConeOuterGainHighFrequency
member.summary: Range [0.0f .. 1.0f] Default: 1.0f A directed Source points in a specified direction. The Source sounds at full volume when the listener is directly in front of the source; it is attenuated as the listener circles the Source away from the front.

member.name: T:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EFXSourceInteger
member.summary: A list of valid Source/GetSource parameters.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EFXSourceInteger.DirectFilter
member.summary: This Source property is used to apply filtering on the direct-path (dry signal) of a Source.

member.name: T:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EFXSourceInteger3
member.summary: A list of valid Source/GetSource parameters.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.EFXSourceInteger3.AuxiliarySendFilter
member.summary: This Source property is used to establish connections between Sources and Auxiliary Effect Slots. For a Source to feed an Effect that has been loaded into an Auxiliary Effect Slot the application must configure one of the Source’s auxiliary sends. This process involves setting 3 variables – the destination Auxiliary Effect Slot ID, the Auxiliary Send number, and an optional Filter ID.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.FilterType.Bandpass
member.summary: Currently not implemented. A band-pass filter is used to remove high and low frequency content from a signal.

member.name: T:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.Creative.EFX.Enums.FormantFilterSettings
member.summary: Vocal morpher effect parameters. If both parameters are set to the same phoneme, that determines the filtering effect that will be heard. If these two parameters are set to different phonemes, the filtering effect will morph between the two settings at a rate specified by EfxEffectf.VocalMorpherRate.

member.summary: The get integer 64 enum

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.SOFT.DeviceClock.Enums.GetInteger64.DeviceClock
member.summary: The audio device clock time, expressed in nanoseconds. NULL is an invalid device. ALC_DEVICE_CLOCK_SOFT

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.SOFT.DeviceClock.Enums.GetInteger64.DeviceLatency
member.summary: The current audio device latency, in nanoseconds. This is effectively the delay for the samples rendered at the the device's current clock time from reaching the physical output. NULL is an invalid device. ALC_DEVICE_LATENCY_SOFT

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.SOFT.DeviceClock.Enums.GetInteger64.DeviceClockLatency
member.summary: Expects a destination size of 2, and provides both the audio device clock time and latency, both in nanoseconds. The two values are measured atomically with respect to one another (i.e. the latency value was measured at the same time the device clock value was retrieved). NULL is an invalid device. ALC_DEVICE_CLOCK_LATENCY_SOFT

member.name: T:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.SOFT.DeviceClock.Enums.SourceDouble
member.summary: The source double enum

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.SOFT.DeviceClock.Enums.SourceDouble.SecOffsetClock
member.summary:
AL_SEC_OFFSET_LATENCY_SOFT
The playback position, along with the device clock, both expressed in seconds. This attribute is read-only.
The first value in the returned vector is the offset in seconds. The value is similar to that returned by , just with more precision.
The second value is the device clock, in seconds. This updates at the same rate as the offset, and both are measured atomically with respect to one another. Be aware that this value may be subtly different from the other device clock queries due to the variable precision of floating-point values.

member.name: T:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.SOFT.DeviceClock.Enums.SourceInteger64
member.summary: The source integer 64 enum

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Extensions.SOFT.DeviceClock.Enums.SourceInteger64.SampleOffsetClock
member.summary:
AL_SAMPLE_OFFSET_CLOCK_SOFT
The playback position, expressed in fixed-point samples, along with the device clock, expressed in nanoseconds. This attribute is read-only.
The first value in the returned vector is the sample offset, which is a 32.32 fixed-point value. The whole number is stored in the upper 32 bits and the fractional component is in the lower 32 bits. The value is similar to that returned by , just with more precision.
The second value is the device clock, in nanoseconds. This updates at the same rate as the offset, and both are measured atomically with respect to one another.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Mathematics.Data.Color4.FromSrgb(Alis.Core.Audio2D.Mathematics.Data.Color4)
member.summary: Converts sRGB color values to RGB color values.
member.param: Color value to convert in sRGB.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Mathematics.Data.Color4.ToSrgb(Alis.Core.Audio2D.Mathematics.Data.Color4)
member.summary: Converts RGB color values to sRGB color values.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Mathematics.Data.Color4.FromHsl(Alis.Core.Audio2D.Mathematics.Vector.Vector4)
member.summary: Converts HSL color values to RGB color values.
member.param: Color value to convert in hue, saturation, lightness (HSL). The X element is Hue (H), the Y element is Saturation (S), the Z element is Lightness (L), and the W element is Alpha (which is copied to the output's Alpha value). Each has a range of 0.0 to 1.0.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Mathematics.Data.Color4.ToHsl(Alis.Core.Audio2D.Mathematics.Data.Color4)
member.summary: Converts RGB color values to HSL color values.
member.returns: Returns the converted color value. The X element is Hue (H), the Y element is Saturation (S), the Z element is Lightness (L), and the W element is Alpha (a copy of the input's Alpha value). Each has a range of 0.0 to 1.0.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Mathematics.Data.Color4.FromHsv(Alis.Core.Audio2D.Mathematics.Vector.Vector4)
member.summary: Converts HSV color values to RGB color values.
member.param: Color value to convert in hue, saturation, value (HSV). The X element is Hue (H), the Y element is Saturation (S), the Z element is Value (V), and the W element is Alpha (which is copied to the output's Alpha value). Each has a range of 0.0 to 1.0.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Mathematics.Data.Color4.ToHsv(Alis.Core.Audio2D.Mathematics.Data.Color4)
member.summary: Converts RGB color values to HSV color values.
member.returns: Returns the converted color value. The X element is Hue (H), the Y element is Saturation (S), the Z element is Value (V), and the W element is Alpha (a copy of the input's Alpha value). Each has a range of 0.0 to 1.0.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Mathematics.Data.Color4.FromXyz(Alis.Core.Audio2D.Mathematics.Vector.Vector4)
member.summary: Converts XYZ color values to RGB color values.
member.param: Color value to convert with the trisimulus values of X, Y, and Z in the corresponding element, and the W element with Alpha (which is copied to the output's Alpha value). Each has a range of 0.0 to 1.0.
member.remarks: Uses the CIE XYZ colorspace.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Mathematics.Data.Color4.ToXyz(Alis.Core.Audio2D.Mathematics.Data.Color4)
member.summary: Converts RGB color values to XYZ color values.
member.returns: Returns the converted color value with the trisimulus values of X, Y, and Z in the corresponding element, and the W element with Alpha (a copy of the input's Alpha value). Each has a range of 0.0 to 1.0.
member.remarks: Uses the CIE XYZ colorspace.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Mathematics.Data.Color4.FromYcbcr(Alis.Core.Audio2D.Mathematics.Vector.Vector4)
member.summary: Converts YCbCr color values to RGB color values.
member.param: Color value to convert in Luma-Chrominance (YCbCr) aka YUV. The X element contains Luma (Y, 0.0 to 1.0), the Y element contains Blue-difference chroma (U, -0.5 to 0.5), the Z element contains the Red-difference chroma (V, -0.5 to 0.5), and the W element contains the Alpha (which is copied to the output's Alpha value).
member.remarks: Converts using ITU-R BT.601/CCIR 601 W(r) = 0.299 W(b) = 0.114 U(max) = 0.436 V(max) = 0.615.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Mathematics.Data.Color4.ToYcbcr(Alis.Core.Audio2D.Mathematics.Data.Color4)
member.summary: Converts RGB color values to YUV color values.
member.returns: Returns the converted color value in Luma-Chrominance (YCbCr) aka YUV. The X element contains Luma (Y, 0.0 to 1.0), the Y element contains Blue-difference chroma (U, -0.5 to 0.5), the Z element contains the Red-difference chroma (V, -0.5 to 0.5), and the W element contains the Alpha (a copy of the input's Alpha value). Each has a range of 0.0 to 1.0.
member.remarks: Converts using ITU-R BT.601/CCIR 601 W(r) = 0.299 W(b) = 0.114 U(max) = 0.436 V(max) = 0.615.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Mathematics.Data.Color4.FromHcy(Alis.Core.Audio2D.Mathematics.Vector.Vector4)
member.summary: Converts HCY color values to RGB color values.
member.param: Color value to convert in hue, chroma, luminance (HCY). The X element is Hue (H), the Y element is Chroma (C), the Z element is luminance (Y), and the W element is Alpha (which is copied to the output's Alpha value). Each has a range of 0.0 to 1.0.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Mathematics.Data.Color4.ToHcy(Alis.Core.Audio2D.Mathematics.Data.Color4)
member.summary: Converts RGB color values to HCY color values.
member.returns: Returns the converted color value. The X element is Hue (H), the Y element is Chroma (C), the Z element is luminance (Y), and the W element is Alpha (a copy of the input's Alpha value). Each has a range of 0.0 to 1.0.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Mathematics.Data.Color4.Equals(Alis.Core.Audio2D.Mathematics.Data.Color4)
member.summary: Compares whether this Color4 structure is equal to the specified Color4.
member.param: The Color4 structure to compare to.
member.returns: True if both Color4 structures contain the same components; false otherwise.

member.name: T:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Mathematics.Data.Half
member.summary: The name Half is derived from half-precision floating-point number. It occupies only 16 bits, which are split into 1 Sign bit, 5 Exponent bits and 10 Mantissa bits.
member.remarks: Quote from ARB_half_float_pixel specification: Any representable 16-bit floating-point value is legal as input to a GL command that accepts 16-bit floating-point data. The result of providing a value that is not a floating-point number (such as infinity or NaN) to such a command is unspecified, but must not lead to GL interruption or termination. Providing a denormalized number or negative zero to GL must yield predictable results.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Mathematics.Data.Half.Equals(Alis.Core.Audio2D.Mathematics.Data.Half)
member.summary: Returns a value indicating whether this instance is equal to a specified OpenTK.Half value.
member.param: OpenTK.Half object to compare to this instance..
member.returns: True, if other is equal to this instance; false otherwise.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Mathematics.Data.Half.CompareTo(Alis.Core.Audio2D.Mathematics.Data.Half)
member.summary: Compares this instance to a specified half-precision floating-point number and returns an integer that indicates whether the value of this instance is less than, equal to, or greater than the value of the specified half-precision floating-point number.
member.param: A half-precision floating-point number to compare.
member.returns:
A signed number indicating the relative values of this instance and value. If the number is:
Less than zero, then this instance is less than other, or this instance is not a number (OpenTK.Half.NaN) and other is a number.
Zero: this instance is equal to value, or both this instance and other are not a number (OpenTK.Half.NaN), OpenTK.Half.PositiveInfinity, or OpenTK.Half.NegativeInfinity.
Greater than zero: this instance is greater than othrs, or this instance is a number and other is not a number (OpenTK.Half.NaN).

member.summary: Gets the points of this curve.
member.remarks: The first point and the last points represent the anchor points.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Mathematics.Geometry.BezierCurve.CalculateLength(System.Collections.Generic.IList{Alis.Core.Audio2D.Mathematics.Vector.Vector2},System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Calculates the length of the specified bezier curve.

remarks.para: The precision gets better as the value gets smaller.

The parameter defines whether the curve should be calculated as a parallel curve to the original bezier curve. A value of 0.0f represents the original curve, 5.0f represents a curve that has always a distance of 5.0f to the orignal curve.

member.summary: Calculates the point on the given bezier curve with the specified t parameter.
member.param: The t parameter, a value between 0.0f and 1.0f.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Mathematics.MathHelper.IEEERemainder(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Returns the remainder resulting from the division of a specified number by another specified number.
member.returns: A number equal to a - (b Q), where Q is the quotient of a / b rounded to the nearest integer (if a / b falls halfway between two integers, the even integer is returned). If a - (b Q) is zero, the value +0 is returned if a is positive, or -0 if a is negative. If b = 0, NaN is returned.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Mathematics.MathHelper.Round(System.Decimal,System.Int32,System.MidpointRounding)
member.summary: Rounds a decimal value to a specified number of fractional digits, and uses the specified rounding convention for midpoint values.
member.param: A decimal number to be rounded.
The number of decimal places in the return value.
Specification for how to round d if it is midway between two other numbers.
member.returns: The number nearest to d that contains a number of fractional digits equal to digits. If d has fewer fractional digits than digits, d is returned unchanged.
member.exception: digits is less than 0 or greater than 28.
mode is not a valid value of MidpointRounding.
The result is outside the range of a Decimal.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Mathematics.MathHelper.Round(System.Double,System.Int32,System.MidpointRounding)
member.summary: Rounds a double-precision floating-point value to a specified number of fractional digits, and uses the specified rounding convention for midpoint values.
member.param: A double-precision floating-point number to be rounded.
The number of fractional digits in the return value.
Specification for how to round d if it is midway between two other numbers.
member.returns: The number nearest to d that has a number of fractional digits equal to digits. If d has fewer fractional digits than digits, d is returned unchanged.
member.exception: digits is less than 0 or greater than 15.
mode is not a valid value of MidpointRounding.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Mathematics.MathHelper.Round(System.Decimal,System.MidpointRounding)
member.summary: Rounds a decimal value to the nearest integer, and uses the specified rounding convention for midpoint values.
member.param: A decimal number to be rounded.
Specification for how to round d if it is midway between two other numbers.
member.returns: The integer nearest d. If d is halfway between two numbers, one of which is even and the other odd, then mode determines which of the two is returned. Note that this method returns a Decimal instead of an integral type.
member.exception: mode is not a valid value of MidpointRounding.
The result is outside the range of a Decimal.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Mathematics.MathHelper.Round(System.Double,System.MidpointRounding)
member.summary: Rounds a double-precision floating-point value to the nearest integer, and uses the specified rounding convention for midpoint values.
member.param: A double-precision floating-point number to be rounded.
Specification for how to round d if it is midway between two other numbers.
member.returns: The integer nearest d. If d is halfway between two integers, one of which is even and the other odd, then mode determines which of the two is returned. Note that this method returns a Double instead of an integral type.
member.exception: mode is not a valid value of MidpointRounding.

This is typically used in place of an epsilon comparison. see: https://randomascii.wordpress.com/2012/02/25/comparing-floating-point-numbers-2012-edition/ see: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/3874627/floating-point-comparison-functions-for-c-sharp.
member.param: the number of floating point bits to check.
member.returns: true if the values are approximately equal; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Approximates double-precision floating point equality by an epsilon (maximum error) value. This method is designed as a "fits-all" solution and attempts to handle as many cases as possible.
member.param: The maximum error between the two.
member.returns: true if the values are approximately equal within the error margin; otherwise, false .

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Mathematics.MathHelper.ApproximatelyEqualEpsilon(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Approximates single-precision floating point equality by an epsilon (maximum error) value. This method is designed as a "fits-all" solution and attempts to handle as many cases as possible.
member.param: The maximum error between the two.
member.returns: true if the values are approximately equal within the error margin; otherwise, false .

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Audio2D.Mathematics.MathHelper.ApproximatelyEquivalent(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Approximates equivalence between two single-precision floating-point numbers on a direct human scale. It is important to note that this does not approximate equality - instead, it merely checks whether or not two numbers could be considered equivalent to each other within a certain tolerance. The tolerance is inclusive.
member.param: The tolerance within which the two values would be considered equivalent.
member.returns: Whether or not the values can be considered equivalent within the tolerance.

member.summary: Creates a perspective projection matrix.
member.param: Angle of the field of view in the y direction (in radians).
Aspect ratio of the view (width / height).
Distance to the near clip plane.
Distance to the far clip plane.
A projection matrix that transforms camera space to raster space.
member.exception:
Thrown under the following conditions:
fovy is zero, less than zero or larger than Math.PI
aspect is negative or zero
depthNear is negative or zero
depthFar is negative or zero
depthNear is larger than depthFar

member.exception:
Thrown under the following conditions:
fovy is zero, less than zero or larger than Math.PI
aspect is negative or zero
depthNear is negative or zero
depthFar is negative or zero
depthNear is larger than depthFar

member.name: T:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Audio.Listener
member.summary: The audio listener is the point in the scene from where all the sounds are heard

member.name: P:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Audio.Listener.GlobalVolume
member.summary: The volume is a number between 0 and 100; it is combined with the individual volume of each sound / music. The default value for the volume is 100 (maximum).

member.name: P:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Audio.Listener.Position
member.summary: 3D position of the listener (default is (0, 0, 0))

member.name: P:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Audio.Listener.Direction
member.summary: The direction (also called "at vector") is the vector pointing forward from the listener's perspective. Together with the up vector, it defines the 3D orientation of the listener in the scene. The direction vector doesn't have to be normalized. The default listener's direction is (0, 0, -1).

member.name: P:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Audio.Listener.UpVector
member.summary: The up vector is the vector that points upward from the listener's perspective. Together with the direction, it defines the 3D orientation of the listener in the scene. The up vector doesn't have to be normalized. The default listener's up vector is (0, 1, 0). It is usually not necessary to change it, especially in 2D scenarios.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Audio.Listener.sfListener_setGlobalVolume(System.Single)
member.summary: Sfs the listener set global volume using the specified volume

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Audio.Listener.sfListener_getGlobalVolume
member.summary: Sfs the listener get global volume

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Audio.Listener.sfListener_setPosition(Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Systems.Vector3f)
member.summary: Sfs the listener set position using the specified position

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Audio.Listener.sfListener_getPosition
member.summary: Sfs the listener get position

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Audio.Listener.sfListener_setDirection(Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Systems.Vector3f)
member.summary: Sfs the listener set direction using the specified direction

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Audio.Listener.sfListener_getDirection
member.summary: Sfs the listener get direction

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Audio.Listener.sfListener_setUpVector(Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Systems.Vector3f)
member.summary: Sfs the listener set up vector using the specified up vector

member.name: T:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Audio.Music
member.summary: Streamed music played from an audio file

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Audio.Music.myStream
member.summary: The my stream

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Audio.Music.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructs a music from an audio file
member.param: Path of the music file to open

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Audio.Music.#ctor(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Constructs a music from a custom stream

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Audio.Music.#ctor(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Constructs a music from an audio file in memory
member.param: Byte array containing the file contents

member.name: P:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Audio.Music.SampleRate
member.summary: Sample rate of the music. The sample rate is the number of audio samples played per second. The higher, the better the quality.

member.name: P:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Audio.Music.ChannelCount
member.summary: Number of channels (1 = mono, 2 = stereo)

member.name: P:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Audio.Music.Status
member.summary: Current status of the music (see SoundStatus enum)

member.name: P:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Audio.Music.Duration
member.summary: Total duration of the music

member.name: P:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Audio.Music.Loop
member.summary: Flag if the music should loop after reaching the end. If set, the music will restart from beginning after reaching the end and so on, until it is stopped or Loop = false is set. The default looping state for music is false.

member.name: P:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Audio.Music.Pitch
member.summary: Pitch of the music. The pitch represents the perceived fundamental frequency of a sound; thus you can make a sound more acute or grave by changing its pitch. A side effect of changing the pitch is to modify the playing speed of the sound as well. The default value for the pitch is 1.

member.name: P:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Audio.Music.Volume
member.summary: Volume of the music. The volume is a value between 0 (mute) and 100 (full volume). The default value for the volume is 100.

member.name: P:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Audio.Music.Position
member.summary: 3D position of the music in the audio scene. Only sounds with one channel (mono sounds) can be spatialized. The default position of a sound is (0, 0, 0).

member.name: P:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Audio.Music.RelativeToListener
member.summary: Make the music's position relative to the listener or absolute. Making a sound relative to the listener will ensure that it will always be played the same way regardless the position of the listener. This can be useful for non-spatialized sounds, sounds that are produced by the listener, or sounds attached to it. The default value is false (position is absolute).

member.name: P:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Audio.Music.MinDistance
member.summary: Minimum distance of the music. The "minimum distance" of a sound is the maximum distance at which it is heard at its maximum volume. Further than the minimum distance, it will start to fade out according to its attenuation factor. A value of 0 ("inside the head of the listener") is an invalid value and is forbidden. The default value of the minimum distance is 1.

member.name: P:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Audio.Music.Attenuation
member.summary: Attenuation factor of the music. The attenuation is a multiplicative factor which makes the music more or less loud according to its distance from the listener. An attenuation of 0 will produce a non-attenuated sound, i.e. its volume will always be the same whether it is heard from near or from far. On the other hand, an attenuation value such as 100 will make the sound fade out very quickly as it gets further from the listener. The default value of the attenuation is 1.

member.name: P:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Audio.Music.PlayingOffset
member.summary: Current playing position of the music. The playing position can be changed when the music is either paused or playing.

member.name: P:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Audio.Music.LoopPoints
member.summary: Current loop points of the music. Since setting performs some adjustments on the provided values and rounds them to internal samples, getting this value later is not guaranteed to return the same times passed into it. However, it is guaranteed to return times that will map to the valid internal samples of this Music if they are later set again.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Audio.Music.Play
member.summary: Start or resume playing the audio stream. This function starts the stream if it was stopped, resumes it if it was paused, and restarts it from beginning if it was it already playing. This function uses its own thread so that it doesn't block the rest of the program while the stream is played.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Audio.Music.Pause
member.summary: Pause the audio stream. This function pauses the stream if it was playing, otherwise (stream already paused or stopped) it has no effect.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Audio.Music.Stop
member.summary: Stop playing the audio stream. This function stops the stream if it was playing or paused, and does nothing if it was already stopped. It also resets the playing position (unlike Pause()).

member.summary: Default constructor

member.name: P:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Audio.SoundRecorder.SampleRate
member.summary: Sample rate of the sound recorder.
member.remarks: The sample rate defines the number of audio samples captured per second. The higher, the better the quality (for example, 44100 samples/sec is CD quality).

member.name: P:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Audio.SoundRecorder.ChannelCount
member.summary: Get/Set the channel count of the audio capture device
member.remarks: This method allows you to specify the number of channels used for recording. Currently only 16-bit mono (1) and 16-bit stereo (2) are supported.

member.name: P:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Audio.SoundRecorder.IsAvailable
member.summary: Check if the system supports audio capture.
member.remarks: This function should always be called before using the audio capture features. If it returns false, then any attempt to use the SoundRecorder or one of its derived classes will fail.

member.name: P:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Audio.SoundRecorder.AvailableDevices
member.summary: Get the list of the names of all available audio capture devices

member.name: P:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Audio.SoundRecorder.DefaultDevice
member.summary: Get the name of the default audio capture device

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Audio.SoundRecorder.Start
member.summary: Start the capture using the default sample rate (44100 Hz). Please note that only one capture can happen at the same time.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Audio.SoundRecorder.Start(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Start the capture. The sampleRate parameter defines the number of audio samples captured per second. The higher, the better the quality (for example, 44100 samples/sec is CD quality). This function uses its own thread so that it doesn't block the rest of the program while the capture runs. Please note that only one capture can happen at the same time.
member.param: Sound frequency; the more samples, the higher the quality (44100 by default = CD quality)

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Audio.SoundRecorder.Stop
member.summary: Stop the capture

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Audio.SoundRecorder.ToString
member.summary: Provide a string describing the object

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Audio.SoundRecorder.OnStart
member.summary: Start capturing audio data. This virtual function may be overridden by a derived class if something has to be done every time a new capture starts. If not, this function can be ignored; the default implementation does nothing.
member.returns: False to abort recording audio data, true to continue

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Audio.SoundRecorder.OnProcessSamples(System.Int16[])
member.summary: Process a new chunk of recorded samples. This virtual function is called every time a new chunk of recorded data is available. The derived class can then do whatever it wants with it (storing it, playing it, sending it over the network, etc.).
member.returns: False to stop recording audio data, true to continue

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Audio.SoundRecorder.OnStop
member.summary: Stop capturing audio data. This virtual function may be overridden by a derived class if something has to be done every time the capture ends. If not, this function can be ignored; the default implementation does nothing.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Audio.SoundRecorder.SetProcessingInterval(Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Systems.Time)
member.summary: The processing interval controls the period between calls to the onProcessSamples function. You may want to use a small interval if you want to process the recorded data in real time, for example. Note: this is only a hint, the actual period may vary. So don't rely on this parameter to implement precise timing. The default processing interval is 100 ms.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Audio.SoundRecorder.SetDevice(System.String)
member.summary: Set the audio capture device
member.param: The name of the audio capture device
member.returns: True, if it was able to set the requested device

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Audio.SoundRecorder.GetDevice
member.summary: Get the name of the current audio capture device
member.returns: The name of the current audio capture device

member.summary: Handle the destruction of the object
member.param: Is the GC disposing the object, or is it an explicit call ?

member.name: T:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Audio.SoundStream
member.summary: Abstract base class for streamed audio sources

member.summary: The my get data callback

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Audio.SoundStream.mySeekCallback
member.summary: The my seek callback

member.summary: The my temp buffer

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Audio.SoundStream.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor

member.name: P:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Audio.SoundStream.SampleRate
member.summary: Sample rate of the stream The sample rate is the number of audio samples played per second. The higher, the better the quality.

member.name: P:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Audio.SoundStream.ChannelCount
member.summary: Number of channels (1 = mono, 2 = stereo)

member.name: P:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Audio.SoundStream.Status
member.summary: Current status of the sound stream (see SoundStatus enum)

member.name: P:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Audio.SoundStream.Loop
member.summary: Flag if the music should loop after reaching the end. If set, the music will restart from beginning after reaching the end and so on, until it is stopped or Loop = false is set. The default looping state for music is false.

member.name: P:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Audio.SoundStream.Pitch
member.summary: Pitch of the stream. The pitch represents the perceived fundamental frequency of a sound; thus you can make a sound more acute or grave by changing its pitch. A side effect of changing the pitch is to modify the playing speed of the sound as well. The default value for the pitch is 1.

member.name: P:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Audio.SoundStream.Volume
member.summary: Volume of the stream. The volume is a value between 0 (mute) and 100 (full volume). The default value for the volume is 100.

member.name: P:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Audio.SoundStream.Position
member.summary: 3D position of the stream in the audio scene. Only sounds with one channel (mono sounds) can be spatialized. The default position of a sound is (0, 0, 0).

member.name: P:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Audio.SoundStream.RelativeToListener
member.summary: Make the stream's position relative to the listener or absolute. Making a sound relative to the listener will ensure that it will always be played the same way regardless the position of the listener. This can be useful for non-spatialized sounds, sounds that are produced by the listener, or sounds attached to it. The default value is false (position is absolute).

member.name: P:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Audio.SoundStream.MinDistance
member.summary: Minimum distance of the music. The "minimum distance" of a sound is the maximum distance at which it is heard at its maximum volume. Further than the minimum distance, it will start to fade out according to its attenuation factor. A value of 0 ("inside the head of the listener") is an invalid value and is forbidden. The default value of the minimum distance is 1.

member.name: P:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Audio.SoundStream.Attenuation
member.summary: Attenuation factor of the stream. The attenuation is a multiplicative factor which makes the music more or less loud according to its distance from the listener. An attenuation of 0 will produce a non-attenuated sound, i.e. its volume will always be the same whether it is heard from near or from far. On the other hand, an attenuation value such as 100 will make the sound fade out very quickly as it gets further from the listener. The default value of the attenuation is 1.

member.name: P:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Audio.SoundStream.PlayingOffset
member.summary: Current playing position of the stream. The playing position can be changed when the music is either paused or playing.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Audio.SoundStream.Play
member.summary: Start or resume playing the audio stream. This function starts the stream if it was stopped, resumes it if it was paused, and restarts it from beginning if it was it already playing. This function uses its own thread so that it doesn't block the rest of the program while the stream is played.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Audio.SoundStream.Pause
member.summary: Pause the audio stream. This function pauses the stream if it was playing, otherwise (stream already paused or stopped) it has no effect.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Audio.SoundStream.Stop
member.summary: Stop playing the audio stream. This function stops the stream if it was playing or paused, and does nothing if it was already stopped. It also resets the playing position (unlike pause()).

member.summary: Enumeration of the blending equations

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Graphics.BlendMode.Equation.Add
member.summary: Pixel = Src * SrcFactor + Dst * DstFactor

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Graphics.BlendMode.Equation.Subtract
member.summary: Pixel = Src * SrcFactor - Dst * DstFactor

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Graphics.BlendMode.Equation.ReverseSubtract
member.summary: Pixel = Dst * DstFactor - Src * SrcFactor

member.summary: Multiply source and dest

member.name: T:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Graphics.PrimitiveType
member.summary: Types of primitives that a VertexArray can render. Points and lines have no area, therefore their thickness will always be 1 pixel, regardless the current transform and view.

members.member: List of individual points
List of individual lines
List of connected lines, a point uses the previous point to form a line
List of individual triangles
List of connected triangles, a point uses the two previous points to form a triangle
List of connected triangles, a point uses the common center and the previous point to form a triangle
List of individual quads
List of connected lines, a point uses the previous point to form a line
List of connected triangles, a point uses the two previous points to form a triangle
List of connected triangles, a point uses the common center and the previous point to form a triangle

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Graphics.RenderTarget.MapPixelToCoords(Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Systems.Vector2i)
member.summary: Convert a point from target coordinates to world coordinates, using the current view This function is an overload of the MapPixelToCoords function that implicitly uses the current view. It is equivalent to: target.MapPixelToCoords(point, target.GetView());

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Graphics.RenderTarget.MapPixelToCoords(Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Systems.Vector2i,Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Graphics.View)
member.summary: Convert a point from target coordinates to world coordinates This function finds the 2D position that matches the given pixel of the render-target. In other words, it does the inverse of what the graphics card does, to find the initial position of a rendered pixel. Initially, both coordinate systems (world units and target pixels) match perfectly. But if you define a custom view or resize your render-target, this assertion is not true anymore, ie. a point located at (10, 50) in your render-target may map to the point (150, 75) in your 2D world -- if the view is translated by (140, 25). For render-windows, this function is typically used to find which point (or object) is located below the mouse cursor. This version uses a custom view for calculations, see the other overload of the function if you want to use the current view of the render-target.
member.param: The view to use for converting the point

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Graphics.RenderTarget.MapCoordsToPixel(Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Systems.Vector2f)
member.summary: Convert a point from world coordinates to target coordinates, using the current view This function is an overload of the mapCoordsToPixel function that implicitly uses the current view. It is equivalent to: target.MapCoordsToPixel(point, target.GetView());
member.returns: The converted point, in target coordinates (pixels)

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Graphics.RenderTarget.MapCoordsToPixel(Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Systems.Vector2f,Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Graphics.View)
member.summary: Convert a point from world coordinates to target coordinates This function finds the pixel of the render-target that matches the given 2D point. In other words, it goes through the same process as the graphics card, to compute the final position of a rendered point. Initially, both coordinate systems (world units and target pixels) match perfectly. But if you define a custom view or resize your render-target, this assertion is not true anymore, ie. a point located at (150, 75) in your 2D world may map to the pixel (10, 50) of your render-target -- if the view is translated by (140, 25). This version uses a custom view for calculations, see the other overload of the function if you want to use the current view of the render-target.
member.param: The view to use for converting the point
member.returns: The converted point, in target coordinates (pixels)

member.summary: Save the current OpenGL render states and matrices. This function can be used when you mix SFML drawing and direct OpenGL rendering. Combined with PopGLStates, it ensures that: \li SFML's internal states are not messed up by your OpenGL code \li your OpenGL states are not modified by a call to a SFML function More specifically, it must be used around code that calls Draw functions. Example: // OpenGL code here... window.PushGLStates(); window.Draw(...); window.Draw(...); window.PopGLStates(); // OpenGL code here... Note that this function is quite expensive: it saves all the possible OpenGL states and matrices, even the ones you don't care about. Therefore it should be used wisely. It is provided for convenience, but the best results will be achieved if you handle OpenGL states yourself (because you know which states have really changed, and need to be saved and restored). Take a look at the ResetGLStates function if you do so.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Graphics2D.Graphics.RenderTarget.PopGLStates
member.summary: Restore the previously saved OpenGL render states and matrices. See the description of PushGLStates to get a detailed description of these functions.
